{{Infobox serial killer | name = Beate Schmidt | image = | caption = | alt = | birthname = Wolfgang Schmidt | alias = Pink Giant
The Beast of Beelitz
Beelitz-Murderer | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|10|5|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Lehnin]], [[Bezirk Potsdam]], [[East Germany]] | death_date = | death_place = | cause = | conviction = [[Murder]] | sentence = 15 years in prison and detention in a psychiatric hospital | victims = 6 | beginyear = October 24, 1989 | endyear = April 5, 1991 | country = [[Germany]] | states = | apprehended = August 1, 1991 }} {{portal|Transgender}} '''Beate Schmidt''' (born '''Wolfgang Schmidt''' October 5, 1966) is a [[Germany|German]] [[serial killer]]. From October 1989 to April 1991, Schmidt murdered five women and an infant. Schmidt is a [[trans woman]]. ==Early life== Schmidt was born Wolfgang Schmidt on October 5, 1966 in [[Lehnin]], [[Brandenburg]], Germany. ==Serial killer== Schmidt murdered five women and a three month old baby: * Edeltraut Nixdorf, 51, killed on October 24, 1989. * Christa Naujoks, 45, raped and strangled to death on May 24, 1990. * Inge Fischer, 34, raped and stabbed to death on March 13, 1991 in [[Beelitz]].{{cite journal | url=http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-13680463.html | title=Ein Ausholen zum Gegenschlag|trans-title=A knock-out to the counter-strike | author=Friedrichsen, Gisela | journal=Der Spiegel |date=November 1992 | issue=45|language=de}} * Tamara Petrowskaja, 44, strangled to death on March 22, 1991. Schmidt struck her son against a tree stump.{{cite news|url=https://www.welt.de/vermischtes/weltgeschehen/article118105840/Der-Serienkiller-darf-sich-ein-bisschen-frei-bewegen.html|trans-title=The serial killer may move a bit freely |title=Der Serienkiller darf sich ein bisschen frei bewegen |newspaper=Die Welt |date=July 16, 2013 |accessdate=30 March 2014 |author=Becker, Claudia |language=de |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714202736/http://www.welt.de/vermischtes/weltgeschehen/article118105840/Der-Serienkiller-darf-sich-ein-bisschen-frei-bewegen.html |archivedate=July 14, 2014 }} * Talita Bremer, 66, strangled to death in April 5, 1991 and corpse was raped. The nickname the "Pink Giant" came from both the killer's size and alleged penchant for pink [[lingerie]].{{cite book|author=Catherine Lupton|title=The Phantom Sanatorium: Beelitz Heilstatten|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=OYjluQAACAAJ|date=1 January 2012|publisher=Solar Books|isbn=978-0-9832480-4-0}} The area where some of the crimes took place led to a second and third moniker, the "Beast of [[Beelitz]]" and "[[Beelitz]]-Murderer". On August 1, 1991 Schmidt was arrested: two men had found Schmidt masturbating while wearing a bra under a jacket. Schmidt was sentenced to 15 years in prison and detention in a psychiatric hospital{{cite web | url=http://www.exberliner.com/visiting/the-haunted-sanatorium-of-beelitz/ | title=The haunted sanatorium of Beelitz | publisher=Exberliner | date=May 5, 2011 | accessdate=30 March 2014 | author=Chalk, Titus | author2=Henze, Jacob | author3=Malmgren, Sigrid | last-author-amp=yes}} in [[Brandenburg an der Havel]].Claus-Dieter Steyer: [http://www.tagesspiegel.de/berlin/brandenburg/verurteilter-serienmoerder-durfte-namen-aendern/1573758.html ''Beate S. statt „Rosa Riese“: Verurteilter Serienmörder durfte Namen ändern'']. Tagesspiegel, 7. August 2009. {{in lang|de}} ==21st century== An application for a name change to Beate Schmidt was met by the court in 2001. Since 2009 Schmidt has undergone a hormone treatment for [[gender reassignment]]. In 2010, Schmidt was investigated for raping and causing another [[transgender]] inmate to attempt suicide.{{cite web | url=http://www.bz-berlin.de/artikel-archiv/hat-der-rosa-riese-wieder-zugeschlagen | title=Hat der Rosa Riese wieder zugeschlagen?|trans-title=Has the pink giant struck again? | publisher=B.Z.|language=de | date=September 9, 2010 | accessdate=30 March 2014}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://murderpedia.org/male.S/s/schmidt-wolfgang.htm Entry at murderpedia.org] {{DEFAULTSORT:Schmidt, Beate}} [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Potsdam-Mittelmark]] [[Category:People from Bezirk Potsdam]] [[Category:20th-century German criminals]] [[Category:Transgender and transsexual women]] [[Category:German serial killers]] [[Category:German rapists]] [[Category:Necrophiles]] [[Category:Female serial killers]] [[Category:German people convicted of murder]] [[Category:People convicted of murder by Germany]]

{{Multiple issues|{{more footnotes|date=May 2018}}{{more citations needed|date=May 2018}}}} {{Infobox serial killer | name = David Thabo Simelane | image = | image_size = | caption = | alt = | birth_name = | alias = David Albert Mhlanga | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1956}} | birth_place = [[Swaziland]] | death_date = | death_place = | cause = | conviction = [[Murder]] | sentence = [[Death]] | victims = 28+ | beginyear = 2000 | endyear = 2001 | country = [[Swaziland]] | states = [[Manzini District]] | apprehended = | imprisoned = }} '''David Thabo Simelane''' (born 1956) is a [[Swaziland|Swazi]] [[serial killer]] sentenced to death for the murder of 28 women, but is suspected of murdering 45.
== Life ==
=== Murders === Simelane left school, although his uncle tried to enable him to attend secondary school.
He testified in court that he had been sentenced to six years' imprisonment for robbing and raping a woman. Then, after his release in 1998, he set out to seek revenge by starting a murder series. The killings lasted from the late 1990s until 2001, when the police arrested him on public grounds.
Simelane made women go with him in the forest. He then tied his victims there and sexually assaulted them, stabbing or strangling them with his bare hands if they resisted too much. He also beheaded many of them, before or after death. Simelane often stole his victims' money and valuables to participate in gambling. Among his victims were several pregnant women.
=== Investigation === Shepherds in search of a runaway cow discovered body parts in the Usuthu-Pulp Forest in [[Malkerns]] and notified the authorities, who soon asked six [[South Africa]]n forensics experts for administrative assistance.
Simelane was arrested in April 2001 on a street near the graves and led the police to more graves, from which 45 bodies were found. Even the bodies of four babies were among the dead. Because of the highly advanced decay, Simelane was charged with 34 murders.
=== Trial and conviction === During the trial he was found guilty of murder in 28 cases and [[sentenced to death]] by hanging. He showed no remorse for his actions during his trial.
After an appeal to the Swazi Supreme Court in November 2011, it was decided that the trial took an inadmissibly long time, but the death sentence that awaited Simelane has been confirmed.
== Personal life == According to his aunt, Simelane found faith in prison and sees himself as a "born-again Christian", preaching to fellow inmates.<ref name="Swaziland News">[http://www.swazilive.com/Swaziland_News/Swaziland_News_Stories.asp?News_id=2722 Swaziland News David SIMELANE gets death penalty, to be hanged]</ref>
== References == <references />
== External links == * [http://www.times.co.sz/News/63119.html Artikel über Simelane] in the Times of Swaziland * [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-12947694 Artikel] from BBC News

{{short description|American serial killer (1952–2020)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2020}} {{Infobox murderer |birth_name= Lonnie David Franklin Jr. |image= Lonnie David Franklin (Grim Sleeper).png |caption= LAPD mug shot 1998 |birth_date= {{birth date|1952|08|30}} |birth_place= [[Los Angeles, California]], U.S. |death_date={{death date and age|2020|03|28|1952|08|30}} |death_place= [[San Quentin, California]], U.S. |alias= Grim Sleeper
Southside Slayer
25 Auto Killer
|sentence= [[Capital punishment in the United States|Death]] |victims= 10-25+ victims, 1 survivor (known) |country= United States |states= California |beginyear= 1985 |endyear= 2007 (known murders) |apprehended= July 7, 2010 |children= 2 }} '''Lonnie David Franklin, Jr.''' (August 30, 1952 – March 28, 2020),{{Cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-03-29/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-lonnie-franklin-dies-death-row-san-quentin|title='Grim Sleeper' serial killer Lonnie Franklin dies on death row at San Quentin|date=March 29, 2020|website=Los Angeles Times}} better known by the nickname '''Grim Sleeper''', was an American [[serial killer]] who was responsible for at least ten murders and one attempted murder in [[Los Angeles]], California.{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/crime/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-lonnie-franklin-dead/|title='Grim Sleeper' Serial Killer Lonnie Franklin Dies in California Prison Cell|website=PEOPLE.com}} He was also convicted for [[rape]] and [[sexual violence]].{{cite web |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/grim-sleeper-guilty-killings_us_572bb5e3e4b016f37895382f|title=Man Found Guilty For All 10 'Grim Sleeper' Killings Of Women|date=2016-05-05|website=The Huffington Post|access-date=2016-05-05}}Christine Pelisek, [http://www.laweekly.com/2008-08-28/news/grim-sleeper/. Grim Sleeper Returns: He's Murdering Angelenos, as Cops Hunt his DNA], ''LA Weekly'', August 28, 2008[http://news.sky.com/story/631629/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-hunted Grim Sleeper Serial Killer Hunted ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610190831/http://news.sky.com/story/631629/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-hunted |date=2016-06-10 }}, SkyNews Report Franklin earned his nickname when he appeared to have taken a 14-year break from his crimes, from 1988 to 2002.{{cite web |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/id/38133825 |title=Arrest in 'Grim Sleeper' killings of ten women, man |date=July 8, 2010 |publisher=NBC News |accessdate=2010-07-08}} In July 2010, Franklin was arrested as a suspect, and, after many delays, his trial began in February 2016. On May 5, 2016, the jury convicted him of killing nine women and one teenage girl.{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/05/us/grim-sleeper-trial-verdict/index.html|title=Jury convicts 'Grim Sleeper' of 10 murders|author=Scott Glover and Paul Vercammen|website=CNN|access-date=2016-05-05}}{{cite web |url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/trial-begins-alleged-grim-sleeper-serial-killer-lonnie/story?id=36974945|title=Trial Begins for Accused 'Grim Sleeper' Serial Killer|date=2016-02-17|publisher=ABC News|access-date=2016-05-05}} On June 6, 2016, the jury recommended the [[death penalty]],{{cite web |url=https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-grim-sleeper-death-verdict-20160606-snap-story.html|title=Jurors vote for death sentence for 'Grim Sleeper' serial killer|last=Times|first=Los Angeles|website=latimes.com|access-date=2016-06-06}} and on August 10, 2016, the Los Angeles Superior Court sentenced him to death for each of the ten victims named in the verdict.{{Cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-grim-sleeper-sentencing-20160810-snap-story.html|title=The 'Grim Sleeper' is sentenced to death for string of murders|last=Gerber|first=Marisa|last2=Queally|first2=James|date=10 August 2016|website=latimes.com|publisher=Los Angeles Times|access-date=2016-08-10}} On March 28, 2020, he was found unresponsive in his cell at [[San Quentin State Prison]] and pronounced dead. ==Personal life== Lonnie David Franklin Jr. was born on August 30, 1952. He grew up in [[South Central Los Angeles]], California.{{cn|date=December 2019}} He married and had two children.{{cn|date=December 2019}} He was given a [[general discharge]] from the [[United States Army]] on July 24, 1975, after having been released from prison for his conviction of gang-raping a 17-year-old girl in [[Stuttgart]], [[West Germany]].{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/crime/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-lonnie-franklin-once-gang-raped-a-german-teen/|title='Grim Sleeper' Serial Killer Lonnie Franklin Once Gang Raped a German Teen|website=PEOPLE.com}} Franklin and two other servicemen stationed in Stuttgart stopped to ask directions from the teen then offered her a ride home. When she accepted, they put a knife to her throat, drove her to a field and repeatedly raped her. She was able to feign interest in Franklin and asked for his phone number, by which police identified him. During the [[gang rape]] photographs were taken by one of the rapists – as was the case with the women Lonnie Franklin raped and murdered.{{Cite web|url=https://abc7.com/1356478/|title=Grim Sleeper jury to hear testimony from earliest known victim|date=May 26, 2016|website=ABC7 Los Angeles}} In 1989, he was also convicted of two charges of theft, one charge of misdemeanor assault, and one charge of [[Battery (crime)|battery]]. He served time for one of the theft charges.{{cite news |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Nightline/familys-dna-led-police-grim-sleeper-serial-killer/story?id=11116381&page=2|title=New Technique of Using Family's DNA Led Police to 'Grim Sleeper' Suspect|publisher=ABC News|date=2010-07-08|accessdate=2010-07-23}} ==Investigation== In the 1980s, the [[Los Angeles Police Department|LAPD]] marked the deaths of several women in [[South Los Angeles, California|South Los Angeles]] with the identification “NHI”, meaning "no humans involved",{{citation needed|date=November 2019}} which was used for cases involving chronic [[drug user]]s and [[prostitution in the United States|prostitutes]]. Margaret Prescod formed the "Black Women Count" movement with community members to pressure the LAPD into acknowledging the deaths as serial killings and forming a task force in response. The coalition launched a media campaign and set a monetary reward aiming to capture the killer. The joint LAPD-[[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]] investigation determined that the crimes were committed by a single person labeled the "Southside Slayer". Their results were announced to the public on September 23, 1985. According to investigators, evidence was found suggesting that several serial killers were murdering women in South Los Angeles. [[Louis Craine]] committed at least two of the "Southside Slayer" murders, and [[Michael Hughes (serial killer)|Michael Hughes]], [[Daniel Lee Siebert]], [[Chester Turner]], and [[Ivan Hill]] committed at least one each.{{cite web |title= Map: Serial Killers in South L.A. |work= Los Angeles Times |date= 3 August 2010 |url= https://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-serialkillersmap-0804-i,0,515310.htmlstory |accessdate= }} A separate series of killings commenced with the murder of Debra Jackson and a different ''[[modus operandi]]'' involving a firearm.{{cite web |last= Jones |first= Jack |title= Man Sought in Slayings of 10 L.A.-Area Prostitutes |work= Los Angeles Times |publisher= |date= 24 September 1985 |url= https://articles.latimes.com/1985-09-24/news/mn-18536_1 |accessdate= }} These became known, misleadingly, as the "Strawberry Murders." Sheriff's Detective Rickey Ross was wrongfully arrested due to a ballistics error. Two decades later, the perpetrator of these crimes was dubbed the "Grim Sleeper" due to the long period of apparent inactivity between murders.{{cite web |author=Jill Stewart |url=http://www.laweekly.com/2010-07-15/news/missing-the-grim-sleeper-by-a-hair/1 |title=Missing the Grim Sleeper by a Hair|work=LA Weekly |date=2010-07-15 |accessdate=2010-12-18}} In May 2007, the slaying of Janecia Peters, 25, was linked through [[DNA]] analysis to at least eleven unsolved murders in Los Angeles, the first of which occurred in 1985. That same year, in secrecy, the LAPD formed the "800 Task Force," composed of six detectives and overseen by the Robbery-Homicide Unit. After a four-month investigation, ''[[LA Weekly]]'' [[investigative journalism|investigative reporter]] Christine Pelisek broke the news of the task force's existence, the link between Peters' killing and the earlier murders, and the silence of [[Mayor of Los Angeles|Mayor]] [[Antonio Villaraigosa]] and Police Chief [[William J. Bratton]] regarding the killer's existence. Villaraigosa and Bratton neither issued a press release nor warned the community. In some cases, ''LA Weekly'' was the first to inform the families that their daughters had long been confirmed as victims of a serial killer. In early September 2008, Los Angeles officials announced that they were offering a $500,000 reward to help catch the killer. On November 1, the case was featured on the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] program ''[[America's Most Wanted]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.amw.com/fugitives/brief.cfm?id=60381/ |title=Most Wanted fugitives website (defunct) |date= |work=[[America's Most Wanted]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121022040939/http://www.amw.com/ |archivedate=2012-10-22 |accessdate=2015-02-20}}{{full citation needed|date=July 2010}} On February 25, 2009, Bratton addressed the press for the first time regarding the case, at which time the police formally gave the killer the "Grim Sleeper" nickname chosen by ''LA Weekly''. Bratton also released a [[9-1-1]] call from the 1980s in which a man reported seeing a body being dumped by Franklin, giving a detailed description and license plate number of a van connected with the now-closed Cosmopolitan Church.{{cite web |last=Pelisek |first=Christine |url=http://blogs.laweekly.com/ladaily/1tape-may-hold-clue-to-identif/ |title=Tape May Hold Clue to Identifying Grim Sleeper Serial Killer – Los Angeles News – The Informer |publisher=Blogs.laweekly.com |date=2009-02-25 |accessdate=2010-07-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090803080447/http://blogs.laweekly.com/ladaily/1tape-may-hold-clue-to-identif/ |archive-date=2009-08-03 |url-status=dead }} In March 2009, Pelisek conducted an extensive interview with Enietra Washington, the sole survivor of Franklin's attacks.{{cite web |author=Christine Pelisek |url=http://www.laweekly.com/2008-08-28/news/grim-sleeper/4 |title=Grim Sleeper Returns: He's Murdering Angelenos, as Cops Hunt his DNA|work=LA Weekly |date=2008-08-28 |accessdate=2010-07-08}}{{cite web |author=Christine Pelisek |url=http://www.laweekly.com/2009-03-12/news/grim-sleeper-39-s-sole-survivor/2 |title=Grim Sleeper's Sole Survivor|work=LA Weekly |date=2009-03-12 |accessdate=2010-07-08}} Washington described him as "a black man in his early 30s [⁠ ⁠.⁠ ⁠.⁠ ⁠.⁠ ⁠] He looked neat. Tidy. Kind of geeky. He wore a black polo shirt tucked into khaki trousers." She also described the interior and exterior of his vehicle.{{cite web |author=Christine Pelisek |url=http://www.laweekly.com/2009-03-12/news/grim-sleeper-39-s-sole-survivor/ |title=Grim Sleeper's Sole Survivor|work=LA Weekly |date=2009-03-12 |accessdate=2010-07-08}} ==Arrest== On July 7, 2010, the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' reported that an arrest had been made. Los Angeles County District Attorney Steve Cooley identified the suspect as 57-year-old Lonnie David Franklin Jr., a mechanic who worked between 1981 and 1988 for the City of Los Angeles in the sanitation department and briefly for the LAPD. Franklin was identified for arrest, at least in part, on [[DNA profiling#DNA evidence as evidence in criminal trials|familial DNA analysis]].{{cite news |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2010/07/lapd-make-arrest-in-grim-sleeper-serial-killings.html |title=LAPD make arrest in Grim Sleeper serial killings |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date= 2010-07-07|accessdate=2010-07-08}} Police had found no exact match between DNA found at the crime scenes and any of the profiles in California's DNA profile database, so they searched the database for stored profiles that demonstrated sufficient similarity to allow police to infer a familial relationship. They found similar DNA belonging to Franklin's son, Christopher, who had been convicted of a [[felony]] weapons charge. According to Cooley, detectives then used a piece of discarded pizza with Franklin's DNA to make the link. One undercover police officer pretended to be a waiter at a restaurant where Franklin ate, collecting dishes, silverware, glasses, and pizza crusts to obtain DNA. The identification was used to arrest Franklin after his DNA was obtained and deemed a match. Saliva found on the victims established a DNA match linking Franklin to the deaths. Law enforcement missed an opportunity to catch Franklin because his DNA was not previously collected. In 2003, Franklin was convicted of a felony and was serving three years of supervised [[probation]]. In 2004, voters passed [[California Proposition 69 (2004)|Proposition 69]], which requires that DNA must be collected from all felons and everyone arrested on some specified charges. It also requires the expansion of the DNA database. Authorities collected and sorted through thousands of DNA samples. While he was on probation, Franklin's DNA was supposed to be entered in the system but was not as probation officers did not collect samples from people who were on unsupervised probation between November 2004 and August 2005. The probation department did not have the resources to collect samples until August 2005.{{cite news |url=https://articles.latimes.com/2010/jul/15/local/la-me-grim-sleeper-dna-20100715|title=Authorities Missed A Chance to Catch Grim Sleeper Suspect|work=Los Angeles Times|date=2010-07-15|accessdate=2010-07-23|first=Jack|last=Leonard}} On December 16, 2010, the LAPD released 180 photos of women, found in Franklin's home after unsuccessful attempts to identify the individuals, possibly additional victims. "These people are not suspects, we don't even know if they are victims, but we do know this: Lonnie Franklin's reign of terror in the city of Los Angeles, which spanned well over two decades, culminating with almost a dozen murder victims, certainly needs to be investigated further," said Police Chief [[Charlie Beck]]. In all, investigators found over 1,000 photos and several hundred hours of video in his home.{{cite news |last=Whitcomb |first=Dan |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE6BF6EU20101216 |title=L.A. police release photos of possible Grim Sleeper victims |publisher=Reuters |date= 2010-12-16|accessdate=2010-12-18}} The images show mainly black women of a wide age range, from teenagers to middle-aged and older, often nude. Police believe Franklin took many of the pictures, which show both conscious and unconscious individuals, dating back 30 years. The photos were released to the public in an effort to identify the women.{{cite news |last=Hayes |first=Kevin |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/8301-504083_162-20026038-504083.html |title="Grim Sleeper" Photos: LAPD Deluged with Calls - Crimesider |publisher=CBS News |accessdate=2010-12-18}}{{cite web |url=https://abcnews.go.com/TheLaw/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-victim-photos-released-los/story?id=12424559 |title=Five Women Tentatively Identified in 'Grim Sleeper' Cas - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |accessdate=2010-12-18}} On November 3, 2011, [[Reuters]] reported that the police were considering Franklin as a suspect in six more slayings of additional female victims. The police were investigating two of the six as potential victims killed during a 14-year lapse between an initial spate of Grim Sleeper murders that ended in 1988 and several more that began in 2002. Of the remaining four victims, two bodies were discovered in the 1980s and two were reported missing in 2005 but the remains of the other two were never found, police said. Detectives said they linked Franklin to the six additional killings after reviewing hundreds of old case files and seeking the public's help in identifying a collection of 180 photographs of women and girls that were found in his possession.{{cite web |last= Kandel |first= Jason |title= Police tie "Grim Sleeper" suspect to six more killings |publisher= Reuters |date= 3 November 2011 |url= https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/03/us-crime-grimsleeper-idUSTRE7A20L120111103 |accessdate= }}{{cite web |last= Rubin |first= Joel |title= Police link 6 more slayings to Grim Sleeper suspect |work= Los Angeles Times |publisher= |date= 29 October 2011 |url= https://articles.latimes.com/2011/oct/29/local/la-me-grim-sleeper-20111029 |accessdate= }}{{cite web |last= Olivia |first= Katrandjian |author2=Lauren Effron |author3=Lauren Sher |author4=Neal Karlinsky |title= Six More Deaths Linked to Grim Sleeper Serial Killer |work= abc NIGHTLINE |publisher= abc NEWS |date= 29 October 2011 |url= https://abcnews.go.com/US/deaths-linked-grim-sleeper-serial-killer/story?id=14842183#.TwMkn_KDtXU |accessdate= }} Franklin was charged with ten murders and one [[attempted murder]]. He was held without [[bail bond|bail]] until he received his [[death sentence]].{{cite news |url=https://articles.latimes.com/2010/jul/16/local/la-me-0716-grim-sleeper-search-20100716|title=Police Collect Hundreds of Pieces of Evidence from Grim Sleeper Suspect's Home|work=Los Angeles Times|date=2010-07-16|accessdate=2010-07-23|first1=Andrew|last1=Blankstein|first2=Joel|last2=Rubin}} He is not charged in the death of an eleventh suspected victim, a black man, a crime for which DNA evidence was not found.{{cite news |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20100709/ap_on_re_us/us_grim_sleeper_killings_34#mwpphu-container|title=LA 'Grim Sleeper' Probe to Check Unsolved Killings|publisher=Yahoo! News|date=2010-07-09|accessdate=2010-07-23}} On May 5, 2016, after nearly three months of trial and a day and a half of jury deliberation, Franklin was convicted of ten counts of murder and one count of attempted murder.{{cite web |url=http://abc7.com/news/lonnie-franklin-jr-found-guilty-in-grim-sleeper-case/1325243/|title=Lonnie Franklin Jr. found guilty in 'Grim Sleeper' case|website=ABC7 Los Angeles|access-date=2016-05-05}}{{cite web |url=https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-grim-sleeper-verdict-20160504-story.html|title=Guilty verdicts in Grim Sleeper serial killer case|last=Times|first=Los Angeles|website=latimes.com|access-date=2016-05-05}} On June 6, 2016, a [[Los Angeles County]] jury sentenced Franklin to death.{{cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-grim-sleeper-death-verdict-20160606-snap-story.html|title=Jurors vote for death sentence for 'Grim Sleeper' serial killer|first=James Queally, Marisa|last=Gerber|publisher=}} ==Victims== The known killings began in 1985 in South Los Angeles. The "Grim Sleeper" apparently took a 14-year hiatus after his last known crime in 1988 and the murders then resumed in 2002 (leading to the epithet by which he is known), but this history may be only an accident of the evidence collected. The last confirmed slaying was in January 2007. All of his victims were found outdoors, often in alleys a short distance from downtown Los Angeles.{{cite news |url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2010/07/07/arrest-la-grim-sleeper-killings/|title=Arrest Made in L.A. 'Grim Sleeper' Killings|publisher=FOX News|date=2010-07-07|accessdate=2010-07-23}} All but one of his victims were black women. One of his suspected victims was a black man. Many of his victims were prostitutes. One witness recalls that Franklin frequently brought prostitutes into his home. He shot all of his victims with a .25 caliber gun. Franklin took many photographs of nude women and kept the records in his garage.{{cite news |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20100708/ap_on_re_us/us_grim_sleeper_killings_23|title=Accused LA Serial Killer Said to Visit Prostitutes |publisher=Yahoo! News|date=2010-07-08|accessdate=2010-07-23}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Franklin's victims are as follows:{{cite web |url=http://www.tiki-toki.com/timeline/entry/260246/Grim-Sleeper-Investigation-Timeline#vars!date=1985-11-02_13:12:56! |title='Grim Sleeper' Timeline |publisher=grimsleeper.wordpress.com |accessdate=2014-03-25}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-grim-sleeper-victims-snap-htmlstory.html|title=Grim Sleeper's victims were vulnerable, young and at times ignored|date=May 5, 2016|website=Los Angeles Times}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Number ! Name ! Sex ! Age ! Body found ! Neighborhood |- | 1 | {{sortname|Debra Ronette|Jackson|nolink=1}} | F | 29 | {{dts|1985|August|10}} | [[Vermont-Slauson, Los Angeles]] |- | 2 | {{sortname|Henrietta|Wright|nolink=1}} | F | 34 | {{dts|1986|August|12}} | [[Hyde Park, Los Angeles]] |- | 3 | {{sortname|Thomas Sylvester|Steele|nolink=1}} ‡ | M | 36 | {{dts|1986|August|14}} | [[Harvard Park, Los Angeles]] |- | 4 | {{sortname|Barbara Bethune|Ware|nolink=1}} | F | 23 | {{dts|1987|January|10}} | [[Central-Alameda, Los Angeles]] |- | 5 | {{sortname|Bernita Rochelle|Sparks|nolink=1}} | F | 26 | {{dts|1987|April|15}} | [[Gramercy Park, Los Angeles]] |- | 6 | {{sortname|Mary Katherine|Lowe|nolink=1}} | F | 26 | {{dts|1987|November|1}} | [[Gramercy Park, Los Angeles]] |- | 7 | {{sortname|Lachrica Denise|Jefferson|nolink=1}} | F | 22 | {{dts|1988|January|30}} | [[Westmont, California|Westmont, Los Angeles County]] |- | 8 | {{sortname|Alicia Monique|Alexander|nolink=1}} | F | 18 | {{dts|1988|September|11}} | [[Vermont Square, Los Angeles]] |- | 9 | {{sortname|Enietra Margette|Washington|nolink=1}}‡‡ | F | 30 | Survived | [[Gramercy Park, Los Angeles]] |- | 10 | {{sortname|Princess Cheyanne|Berthomieux|nolink=1}} | F | 15 | {{dts|2002|March|19}} | [[Inglewood, California]] |- | 11 | {{sortname|Valerie Louise|McCorvey|nolink=1}} | F | 35 | {{dts|2003|July|11}} | [[Westmont, California|Westmont, Los Angeles County]] |- | 12 | {{sortname|Janecia Lavette|Peters|nolink=1}} | F | 25 | {{dts|2007|January|1}} | [[Gramercy Park, Los Angeles]] |} ‡ One of Franklin's suspected victims, although there is no DNA evidence to support the accusation. Police said that the male victim, Thomas Steele, possibly was a friend of another victim or had discovered the killer's identity.
‡‡ Enietra "Margette" was told to use her middle name as her last name for her protection, but has since come forward as Enietra Margette Washington. Attacked on November 20, 1988, she is the only known survivor. ==Trial== On July 7, 2010, Lonnie David Franklin Jr., 57, was arrested. The Los Angeles County District Attorney's Office charged him with ten counts of murder, one count of attempted murder, and special circumstance allegations of multiple murders in the case.{{cite news |last= Simon |first=Mallory |title= Police Suspect in Los Angeles Grim Sleeper case to be arraigned |work= [[CNN.com]] |date= 2010-07-08 |url= http://www.cnn.com/2010/CRIME/07/08/grim.sleeper.case/index.html?hpt=T2 |accessdate= 2010-07-08}}{{cite news |last= The Associated Press |title= Police make arrest in 'Grim Sleeper' killings |work= NBC News |date= 2010-07-07 |url= https://www.nbcnews.com/id/38133825 |accessdate= 2010-07-07}} After a lengthy pretrial [[Discovery (law)|discovery]][http://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2013/12/02/grim-sleepers-defense-attorney-asks-to-photograph-nearly-900-pieces-of-evidence/ Grim Sleeper's Defense Attorney Asks To Photograph Nearly 900 Pieces Of Evidence], CBS Los Angeles (December 2, 2013) and several delays, the trial opened on February 16, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyherald.com/article/20150206/news/302069980|title=Judge sets June trial date in 'Grim Sleeper' serial killings|first=BRIAN|last=MELLEY|date=6 February 2015|publisher=}}{{Cite trial begins in Los Angeles], The Guardian (17 February 2016) Closing arguments began May 2, 2016[http://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2016/05/02/closing-arguments-grim-sleeper-trial/?e=o8Tn-Ny*OAG9Ww 2016). The jury convicted Franklin on all counts on May 5, 2016.[http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/05/us/grim-sleeper-trial-verdict/index.html Los Angeles jury convicts 'Grim Sleeper' of 10 murders] CNN (5 May 2016) On June 6, 2016, the jury rendered a verdict of death.[http://abc7.com/news/decision-reached-in-penalty-phase-for-grim-sleeper/1373724/ 'Grim Sleeper', convicted serial killer Lonnie Franklin Jr., sentenced to death] ABC7 Los Angeles (6 June 2016) On August 10 the Superior Court sentenced Franklin on each count, naming the individual victims. ==Death== On March 28, 2020, Franklin was found unresponsive in his cell and was pronounced dead at 7:43 p.m.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/grim-sleeper-serial-killer-lonnie-franklin-jr-found-dead-prison-n1171686|title='Grim Sleeper' serial killer Lonnie Franklin Jr. found dead in prison cell|website=NBC News}} His cause of death is pending the results of an autopsy; however, there were no signs of trauma. ==Film and television== * In 2014, British filmmaker [[Nick Broomfield]] created a documentary film about Franklin, ''[[Tales of the Grim Sleeper]].''"Overlooked by authorities in America, a British filmmaker tackles the Grim Sleeper", ''Toronto Star'', 25 April 2014, WD5. * In 2014, [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]] premiered a movie, ''The Grim Sleeper'', based on the case. It was produced by [[Michael Jaffe]] Films Ltd. and stars [[Dreama Walker]], [[Macy Gray]], [[Ernie Hudson]], and [[Michael O'Neill (actor)|Michael O’Neill]]. * The story was covered during season 1 of the [[Investigation Discovery]] show ''The Face of Evil'' in episode 4 titled, "The Grim Sleeper", which premiered on May 9, 2019.{{cite web|title=The Face of Evil|url=https://www.investigationdiscovery.com/tv-shows/the-face-of-evil//|date=May 9, 2019}} == See also == {{Portal|Biography|Film|Television}} * [[List of serial killers in the United States]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *Brittny Mejia, [https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-grim-sleeper-defense-backtracks-expert-witness-20151109-story.html Grim Sleeper: Defense Backtracks on Expert Witness,"] Brittny Mejia, ''Los Angeles Times,'' November 9, 2015 *Christine Pelisek, [http://www.laweekly.com/informer/2008/09/02/la-weekly-catches-grief-over-serial-killer-nickname LA Weekly Catches Grief Over Serial Killer Nickname], ''LA Weekly,'' September 2, 2008 *Joel Rubin and Richard Winton, [https://articles.latimes.com/2008/aug/29/local/me-killer29 Police on the Hunt for Serial Killer] Los Angeles Times,'' August 29, 2008 ==External links== *[http://www.lapdonline.org/grimsleeper Los Angeles Police Department "Grim Sleeper" page]{{snd}}features photographs of unidentified potential victims *[http://www.cnn.com/SPECIALS/2009/news/grim.sleeper/index.html CNN.com – Grim Sleeper] CNN Special Report; {{more citations needed|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox serial killer | name=Efren Saldivar | image= | image_size= | caption=Mugshot | birth_name= | alias= | birth_date={{Birth date and age|1969|9|30}} | birth_place=[[Brownsville, Texas]], [[United States]] | death_date= | cause= | victims=6–200+ | country=[[United States]] | states=[[California]] | beginyear=1988 | endyear=1998 | apprehended=13 March 1998
| penalty=Six consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole }}
'''Efren Saldivar''' (born September 30, 1969) is an [[United States|American]] [[serial killer]] who murdered patients while working as a [[respiratory therapist]] in the state of [[California]].
==Early life== Born in [[Brownsville, Texas]], he graduated from the College of Medical and Dental Careers in [[North Hollywood, California]] in 1988. He obtained work as a respiratory therapist employed by the [[Adventist Health Glendale|Glendale Adventist Medical Center]], working the [[shift work|night shift]] when there were fewer staff on duty.
==Murders== He killed his patients by injecting a [[paralytic]] drug which led to respiratory and/or [[cardiac arrest]]. These drugs could have included [[morphine]] and [[suxamethonium chloride]] as they were found in his locker with fresh and used syringes.<ref name=ramsland>[http://www.crimelibrary.com/notorious_murders/angels/efren_saldivar/1.html All about Efren Saldivar] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060429114631/http://www.crimelibrary.com/notorious_murders/angels/efren_saldivar/1.html |date=2006-04-29 }}, by Katherine Ramsland, at Crimelibrary.com</ref> [[Pancuronium]] (brand name Pavulon) definitely was used in six murders;<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkillers/S/SALDIVAR_efren.php |title=Serial killer true crime library - Effren Saldivar |access-date=2006-05-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080521161131/http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkillers/S/SALDIVAR_efren.php |archive-date=2008-05-21 |url-status=dead }}</ref> this drug is used to stop a patient's [[respiratory system|respiration]] when they are about to be put on a [[medical ventilator]]. He was careful in the selection of his victims, choosing those who were unconscious and close to death. This led to no easily detectable rise in the rate or distribution of patient deaths when he was on duty. This in turn hampered the investigation, as there were no easily discernible correlations between changes in the distribution or rate of deaths and his shift pattern (a commonly used tool in examining whether [[malpractice]] is taking place).
His medical employment was ended on March 13, 1998. Shortly afterward, he confessed to 50 murders (a confession he later retracted). In searching for evidence that would be strong enough to obtain a court conviction, the police exhumed the remains of patients who had died while Saldivar had been on duty and been buried (rather than [[cremation|cremated]]). The marker that was being sought was unusually high levels of Pavulon in the cadaver, as this drug remains identifiable for many months (unlike succinylcholine chloride and [[morphine]] which are decomposed into innocuous compounds relatively rapidly).
After 20 exhumations, six cadavers had evidence of a lethal concentration of Pavulon. On March 12, 2002 Saldivar [[guilty plea|pleaded guilty]] to those six counts of murder and received six consecutive [[life sentence]]s without the possibility of [[parole]]. He is incarcerated in [[California Substance Abuse Treatment Facility and State Prison, Corcoran]].
==Number of victims== The former head of the respiratory care department at [[Loma Linda University]], Tom Malinowski, led the internal investigation by [[Adventist Health System|Adventist Health]]. Statistical analysis indicates that the total number of murders committed by Saldivar could be as high as 200, but no convincing physical evidence will ever be available to confirm or refute this possibility due to bodies being cremated after death or simply the effects of bodily harm.
== See also == * [[List of serial killers in the United States]]

{{short description|American murderer and suspected serial killer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox serial killer | name = Gerard John Schaefer | image = Gerard John Schaefer.jpg | caption = | birth_name = Gerard John Schaefer Jr. | alias = Jerry Shepherd | birth_date = March 25, 1946 | birth_place = [[Wisconsin]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|1995|12|3|1946|03|25}} | death_place = [[Florida State Prison]] in [[Bradford County, Florida]], U.S. | cause = Multiple stab wounds | spouse = {{ubl | {{marriage|Martha Fogg
|1968|May 1970|end=divorced}} | {{married|Teresa Dean
|September 1971|November 1973|end=divorced}} }} | country = United States | states = [[Florida]] | beginyear = 1969 | endyear = 1973 | victims = 2–30+ | apprehended = April 7, 1973 | conviction = [[Murder]] | sentence = [[Life imprisonment]] | imprisoned = [[Florida State Prison]] }} '''Gerard John Schaefer Jr.''' (March 25, 1946{{spnd}}December 3, 1995) was an American murderer and suspected [[serial killer]] who was imprisoned in 1973 for murders he committed while he was a sheriff's deputy in [[Martin County, Florida|Martin County]], [[Florida]]. Schaefer was convicted of two murders, but was suspected of many others. He frequently appealed against his conviction, but privately boasted, both verbally and in writing, of killing more than thirty women and girls. In December 1995, Schaefer was stabbed to death in his prison cell. == Early life == Gerard Schaefer was the first of three children born to [[Catholic Church|Catholic]] parents, Gerard and Doris Marie (née Runcie) Schaefer. He was born in [[Wisconsin]] and was raised in [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], where he attended [[Marist School (Georgia)|Marist Academy]] until 1960 when his family moved to [[Fort Lauderdale]], [[Florida]]. Schaefer did not get along well with his father, who he believed favored his sister.{{cite book | first1=Catherine|last1=Cole|first2=Cynthia|last2=Young|chapter-url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7K4amzFbIrYC&pg=PA50&lpg=PA50&dq=St.+Thomas+Aquinas+High+School+Gerard+Schaefer&source=bl&ots=xYZXzXo-11&sig=IrrVelIDattEMG4MVndcjeeU5nw&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi11_j5yuPbAhWTAHwKHaoSBKI4ChDoAQhDMAg#v=onepage&q=St.%20Thomas%20Aquinas%20High%20School%20Gerard%20Schaefer&f=false |title=True Crime: Florida: The State's Most Notorious Criminal Cases |publisher=Stackpole Books |location=Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania|date=2011|page=50|chapter=The Cop Killer|isbn=978-0811744393}} In his teens, he began an obsession with women's [[underwear]] and became a [[Voyeurism|peeping tom]], spying on a neighbor girl named Leigh Hainline, of whose subsequent murder he is suspected. Schaefer would later admit to [[zoosadism|killing animals]] in his youth and [[cross dressing]], although at other times he claimed the latter was solely part of his successful attempt to avoid the [[Conscription|draft]] during the [[Vietnam War]].{{cite book | first1=Catherine|last1=Cole|first2=Cynthia|last2=Young|chapter-url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7K4amzFbIrYC&pg=PA50&lpg=PA50&dq=St.+Thomas+Aquinas+High+School+Gerard+Schaefer&source=bl&ots=xYZXzXo-11&sig=IrrVelIDattEMG4MVndcjeeU5nw&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi11_j5yuPbAhWTAHwKHaoSBKI4ChDoAQhDMAg#v=onepage&q=St.%20Thomas%20Aquinas%20High%20School%20Gerard%20Schaefer&f=false |title=True Crime: Florida: The State's Most Notorious Criminal Cases |publisher=Stackpole Books |location=Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania|date=2011|page=50|chapter=The Cop Killer|isbn=978-0811744393}} After graduating from [[St. Thomas Aquinas High School (Fort Lauderdale, Florida)|St. Thomas Aquinas High School]] in 1964,{{cite book | first1=Catherine|last1=Cole|first2=Cynthia|last2=Young|chapter-url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7K4amzFbIrYC&pg=PA50&lpg=PA50&dq=St.+Thomas+Aquinas+High+School+Gerard+Schaefer&source=bl&ots=xYZXzXo-11&sig=IrrVelIDattEMG4MVndcjeeU5nw&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi11_j5yuPbAhWTAHwKHaoSBKI4ChDoAQhDMAg#v=onepage&q=St.%20Thomas%20Aquinas%20High%20School%20Gerard%20Schaefer&f=false |title=True Crime: Florida: The State's Most Notorious Criminal Cases |publisher=Stackpole Books |location=Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania|date=2011|page=50|chapter=The Cop Killer|isbn=978-0811744393}} Schaefer went to college at [[Florida Atlantic University]], and got married during that time. In 1969, he became a teacher at [[Plantation High School]], but was soon fired for "totally inappropriate behavior", according to the principal.{{cite book |first=RJ |last=Parker |editor-first=Deb |editor-last=Hartwell|chapter-url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fmfxBQAAQBAJ&pg=PA137 |title=Serial Killer Groupies |date=2014 |pages=136–37 |chapter=Protect and Serve: Gerard John Schaefer |doi= |hdl= |isbn=978-1-5025-4090-4 |issn= |eissn= |lccn= |oclc= |ol=}} After being turned down from the [[priesthood]], Schaefer turned to law enforcement as a career, graduating as a patrolman at the end of 1971 at age 25. == Arrest == On July 21, 1972, Schaefer picked up two teenage girls who were [[hitchhiking]] while on patrol. He abducted them, took them to a remote forest and tied them to trees where he threatened to kill them or sell them into [[prostitution]]. However, Schaefer was called away on his police radio, leaving the girls tied up. He vowed that he would return. The two girls, who were aged 17 and 18, escaped their bonds and went to the nearest police station, which was actually their kidnapper's own station. When Schaefer returned to the woods and found his victims gone, he called his station and claimed that he had done "something foolish", explaining that he had pretended to kidnap and threaten to kill two hitchhikers in order to scare them into avoiding such an irresponsible method of travel. Schaefer's boss did not believe him and he ordered Schaefer to the station, where he was stripped of his badge and charged with [[false imprisonment]] and [[assault]]. After posting [[bail]], Schaefer was released. Two months later, on September 27, 1972, Schaefer abducted, [[torture]]d, and murdered Susan Place, aged 17, and Georgia Jessup, 16, and buried them in Oak Hammock Park in [[Port Saint Lucie, Florida]]. In December 1972, Schaefer appeared in court in relation to the July abductions. Due to a [[plea bargain]], he was able to plead guilty to just one charge of [[aggravated assault]], for which he received a sentence of one year. == Murder conviction == In April 1973, over six months after they vanished, the [[decomposition|decomposing]], mutilated remains of Place and Jessup were found. The girls had been tied to a tree at some point and had vanished while hitchhiking. These similarities to Schaefer's treatment of the girls who had escaped led the police to obtain a search warrant for the house he and his wife shared with Schaefer's mother. In Schaefer's bedroom, the police found lurid stories he had written that were full of descriptions of the torture, [[rape]], and murder of women, whom he routinely referred to as "whores" and "sluts". More damningly, the authorities found personal possessions such as [[jewelry]], [[Diary|diaries]], and in one case, [[teeth]] from at least eight young women and girls who had gone missing in recent years. Some of the jewelry was from Leigh Hainline Bonadies, Schaefer's neighbor from when they were teenagers.{{Cite web |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1346&dat=19780512&id=T1RNAAAAIBAJ&sjid=qfoDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6167,3669114&hl=en |title=Lakeland Ledger |access-date=September 13, 2016}} Bonadies had vanished in 1969 in Fort Lauderdale, after leaving a note for her husband saying she was making a short trip to [[Miami]]. Schaefer was never charged in connection with her case. Her skull, which was found to have multiple bullet holes, was discovered at a construction site in [[Palm Beach County]] in April 1978 and identified one month later.{{Cite web |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1346&dat=19780512&id=T1RNAAAAIBAJ&sjid=qfoDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6167,3669114&hl=en |title=Lakeland Ledger |access-date=September 13, 2016}} Also among the items was a purse identified as belonging to Place. Place's mother later identified Schaefer as being the man she last saw with her daughter and Jessup. Schaefer was charged with the murders of Place and Jessup. In October 1973, he was found guilty and given two [[life sentence]]s. Authorities soon stated that he was linked to around 30 missing women and girls. Place and Jessup may not have been Schaefer's final victims; two 14-year-old girls named Mary Briscolina and Elsie Farmer vanished while hitchhiking on October 23, 1972, just a few weeks after Place and Jessup were killed.{{cite web |url=http://web.ukonline.co.uk/ruth.buddell/schaefer.htm |title=Gerard Schaefer |website=Murderers Database (United Kingdom) |accessdate=September 3, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100710153845/http://web.ukonline.co.uk/ruth.buddell/schaefer.htm |archivedate=July 10, 2010}} Their bodies were later recovered, and jewelry belonging to one of the girls was later found in Schaefer's home. == Imprisonment and death == Schaefer [[appeal]]ed his conviction, claiming at one point that he had been framed. All his appeals were rejected. Schaefer later began filing [[frivolous lawsuit]]s, trying to sue one [[True crime (genre)|true crime]] writer, Patrick Kendrick, for describing him as "an overweight, doughy, middle aged man who preyed on victims who were psychologically and physiologically weaker than him", and separately trying to sue authors [[Sondra London]], [[Colin Wilson]] and [[Michael Newton (author)|Michael Newton]] and former FBI agent [[Robert Ressler]] for describing Schaefer as a [[serial killer]]. In support of her defense against the lawsuit, London compiled an exhibit of photocopies of 500 incriminating pages of his handwritten correspondence, and the judge dismissed Schaefer's complaint without further ado. After London provided copies of the 500-page exhibit to Newton and Wilson, Schaefer's lawsuits against them were also dismissed. Kendrick's suit was continued until Schaefer's own murder in prison. Until his death Schaefer continued to threaten Sondra London. He also wrote threatening letters to Kendrick, suggesting he had willing agents who would do his bidding and that Schaefer "would hate to see something happen to your family". Kendrick went on to write fiction novels often describing brutal murders, which he relates to his experience with Schaefer. On December 3, 1995, Schaefer was found stabbed to death in his cell. Fellow inmate Vincent Rivera was convicted in 1999 of killing Schaefer and had 53 years and ten months added to the life-plus-twenty years sentence he was already serving for double murder. Rivera did not confess to the crime, nor give a motive, although he did reveal highly relevant circumstances in correspondence he sent to Sondra London; to wit, Rivera had been an ear-witness to the prison murder of Frank Valdes in the second assault by corrections staff he sustained. Rivera had written a complaint about the first assault on Valdez, and was still held in the cell next to Valdez when the second beating killed him. Rivera was actively resisting the cover-up claiming Valdez had killed himself, filing multiple grievances and appeals, when he was accused of killing Schaefer. Schaefer's sister Sara told reporters that Schaefer's murder was a cover-up related to his attempts to verify the confession to the killing of [[Murder of Adam Walsh|Adam Walsh]] that [[Ottis Toole]] had made and then subsequently retracted. Sondra London declared it was more likely due to Schaefer informing on other inmates. In the year before his demise, Schaefer repeatedly had human wastes thrown at him, and had his cell set on fire twice. Schaefer made multiple statements to London, to the effect that he used his status as a "death row law clerk" to get confidential information from prisoners which found their way to the prosecutor's office, only to be used at trial against the inmates. Schaefer's classification officer stated to Sondra London that this was why Schaefer was under siege, because Schaefer's last attempt to curry favor with authorities had targeted an inmate who was well respected behind bars. Official sources put out the story that Vincent Rivera killed Schaefer in an argument over a cup of coffee, but after attending the murder trial and debriefing Rivera, Sondra London declared this story implausible, noting several little-known facts: a full-palm print in blood was found on the wall of Schaefer's cell, but when lab results failed to match it to either Schaefer or Rivera, the evidence was thrown out instead of being presented to the jury. Schaefer's body was found covered with boot prints, and expert testimony at Rivera's trial established that the patterns of the prints matched those of boots issued to corrections officers. It was further established that no prisoners were allowed to wear those particular boots. At the time of Schaefer's death, Broward County homicide detective John King and homicide chief Tim Bronson were preparing to bring charges against Schaefer for three more unsolved murders to ensure he would never get out of prison. == Alleged victims == * Nancy Leichner (21) and Pamela Ann Nater (20) (both disappeared October 2, 1966){{cite web |title=Pamela Ann Nater |work=The Doe Network |url=http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/1497dffl.html |accessdate=April 28, 2012}}{{cite web |title=Nancy Leichner |work=The Doe Network |url=http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/1498dffl.html |accessdate=April 28, 2012}} *Collette Goodenough (19) and Barbara Wilcox (19) (both disappeared January 8, 1969) [https://www.websleuths.com/forums/threads/fl-gerard-schaefer-how-many-victims.34741/ Websleuths] *Leigh Hainline Bonadies (disappeared September 8, 1969)[http://www.doenetwork.org/closed2004.php Doe network] * Carmen Marie Hallock (22) (disappeared December 18, 1969) *Peggy Rahn (9) and Wendy Stevenson (8) both disappeared on December 29, 1969. Schaefer sent a letter to his girlfriend in which he confessed to killing them. Peggy and Wendy's bodies have never been found. * Debora Sue Lowe (13) (disappeared February 29, 1972). Lowe's family believes Schaefer was involved in her disappearance, and Lowe was known to Schaefer.{{cite web |title=Debora Sue Lowe |work=The Charley Project |url=http://charleyproject.org/case/debora-sue-lowe |accessdate=June 14, 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180613131154/http://charleyproject.org/case/debora-sue-lowe |archive-date=June 13, 2018}} * Mary Briscolina (14) and Elsie Farmer (14) vanished while hitchhiking on October 23, 1972 == ''Killer Fiction'' == Sondra London, a true crime writer who had been Schaefer's girlfriend in high school, interviewed him at length following his conviction, and published a compilation of his short stories and drawings entitled ''Killer Fiction'' in 1990. A second book, ''Beyond Killer Fiction'', followed two years later. Schaefer's stories typically involved savage, graphic torture and murder of women, usually from the perspective of the killer, who was often a rogue police officer.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=gur-CgAAQBAJ&pg=PT95 |title=Sex Beast{{nnbsp}}: Sur la trace du pire tueur en série de tous les temps |date=2015 |page=95 |first=Stéphane |last=Bourgoin |language=fr |trans-title=Sex Beast: On the Trail of the Worst Serial Killer of All Time |publisher=Grasset |location=Paris |isbn=978-2-246-85511-8}} A revised edition of ''Killer Fiction'', released after Schaefer's death, included stories and rambling articles from the first two books and a collection of letters to London, in which Schaefer confessed to killing 34 women and girls, and bragged that he had impressed fellow inmate [[Ted Bundy]].Gerard John Schaefer's Art. [http://serialkillers.com/index.php/art/ Serial Killer Art and Kitsch.] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150530051103/http://serialkillers.com/index.php/art/ |date=May 30, 2015 }} Retrieved May 29, 2015. London noted that at the time Schaefer was corresponding with her, he was publicly proclaiming his innocence and threatening to sue anyone who labeled him a serial killer. In one letter, Schaefer wrote that he began murdering women in 1965, when he was 19. In another, he boasted of killing and [[cannibal]]izing two schoolgirls, nine-year-old Peggy Rahn and eight-year-old Wendy Stevenson, who vanished in December 1969.{{cite web |id=2241DFFL |title=Peggy Rahn |work=The Doe Network |url=http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/2241dffl.html |date=March 17, 2017}}{{cite web |id=2242DFFL |title=Wendy Brown Stevenson |work=The Doe Network |url=http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/2242dffl.html |date=March 17, 2017}} Publicly, Schaefer had denied any involvement.{{cite book |last=Schaefer |first=G.J. |author-link=Gerard Schaefer |editor-last=London |editor-first=Sondra |editor-link=Sondra London |title=Killer Fiction |publisher=Feral House |location=Vancouver, Washington|date=2011 |isbn=978-1-936239-19-1}}{{rp|82–90}} London ended her collaboration with Schaefer in 1991, after repudiating his story that he was merely a "framed ex-cop" who wrote lurid fiction. When she stated that he was indeed every bit the serial killer he simultaneously boasted of being, Schaefer allegedly repeatedly threatened her life and filed suit against her for calling him a serial killer in print.{{rp|142}} == See also == * [[List of serial killers in the United States]] == Further reading and films == * Howard, Justice ''TERRIBLE THINGS'' [https://www.amazon.com/Terrible-Things-Notorious-Serial-Schaefer-ebook/dp/B07Y4NNVBM/ref=sr_1_1?crid=12HI7PO2F0A0J&keywords=terrible+things+justice+howard&qid=1569546840&s=gateway&sprefix=terrible+things%2Caps%2C272&sr=8-1 TERRIBLE THINGS -Book on GJ Schaefer] * [[Sparrow, Eric Jonathan]], AKA [[Merrick Sparrow]] ''Petrified, An Original Screenplay'' (2014) & ''ANOMALY: Devil's Night at the Devil's Tree, A Paranormal Investigation'' Harbinger Press (2013), p. 136. * [[Rommel, Keith]] ''The Devil Tree: The Legend Of'' ''Port Saint Lucie'' Pennsylvania: Sunbury Press (2015), p. 192. {{ISBN|978-1620065884}} * Ressler, Robert K. and Schachtman, Tom ''Whoever Fights Monsters: My Twenty Years Hunting Serial Killers for the FBI.'' New York: St. Martin's Press, 1992, pp. 122–127. {{ISBN|0-312-07883-8}} * ''The Devil Tree Uncovered'' Investigation Documentary produced by Nicole K. Rankin == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20050419152606/http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/gerard_schaefer/1.html?sect=2 Schaefer at the Crime Library, by Michael Newton] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20081018233841/http://home.online.no/~janbruun/writings/beauty.html Interview with Schaefer] *[http://www.dc.state.fl.us/offenderSearch/detail.aspx?Page=Detail&DCNumber=518548&TypeSearch=AI Inmate Population Information Detail: Vincent Faustino Rivera (convicted of killing Schaefer)]. ''[[Florida Department of Corrections]]''. {{short description|American serial killer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox serial killer | name=Tommy Lynn Sells | image=Tommy Lynn Sells.jpg | image_size=200px | birthname= | alias="Coast to Coast," The Cross-country Killer | birth_date={{Birth date|1964|06|28}} | birth_place=[[Oakland, California]], U.S. | death_date={{death date and age|2014|4|3|1964|6|28}} | death_place=[[Huntsville, Texas]], U.S. | cause=[[Lethal injection]] | country=[[United States]] | states=[[Missouri]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[Illinois]], [[Texas]], [[Kentucky]],<ref name="clark">{{citeweb| url=http://www.clarkprosecutor.org/html/death/US/sells1374.htm|title=Tommy Lynn Sells|publisher=Office of the Clark County Prosecuting Attorney|accessdate=December 11, 2018}}</ref> (possibly others) | beginyear=1980 | endyear=December 31, 1999 | apprehended=January 2, 2000 | victims= 1 conviction; 22+ suspected | conviction=[[Felony theft]], [[Grand Theft Auto (crime)|grand theft auto]], [[malicious wounding]], [[murder]], [[public intoxication]], [[theft]] (September 18, 2000) | sentence=[[Death penalty|Death]] (September 20, 2000) }}
'''Tommy Lynn Sells''' (June 28, 1964 – April 3, 2014) was an [[United States|American]] [[serial killer]]. He was convicted of one murder, for which he received the death penalty and was eventually executed. Authorities believe he committed a total of 22 murders.
==Early life== Sells and his twin sister, Tammy Jean, contracted [[meningitis]] when they were 18 months old; Tammy died from the illness.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Stone|first1=Michael H.|title=The Anatomy of Evil|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IVRfs_5TmpYC&pg=PA229&lpg=PA229&dq=Tommy+Lynn+Sells+meningitis&source=bl&ots=vYjB6NAweE&sig=--kYgrIppA7tRFRTva6icfkkSWI&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjMx8rdiKTUAhUS0mMKHUKrDLg4ChDoAQhNMAg#v=onepage&q=Tommy%20Lynn%20Sells%20meningitis&f=false|publisher=Prometheus Books|accessdate=June 4, 2017|page=229 |language=en|date=2009}}</ref><ref name="mac">{{cite news|last1=MacCormack|first1=John|title=Killer Smile|url=http://www.dallasobserver.com/news/killer-smile-6394042|accessdate=June 4, 2017|work=[[Dallas Observer]]|date= September 28, 2000}}</ref> Shortly thereafter, Sells was sent to live with his aunt, Bonnie Walpole, in [[Holcomb, Missouri]]. When he was five years old, he was returned to his mother after she found out his aunt wanted to adopt him.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.thoughtco.com/serial-killer-tommy-lynn-sells-973154|title=Profile of Serial Killer Tommy Lynn Sells|publisher=ThoughtCo|date= February 22, 2018|accessdate= December 11, 2018|first=Charles|last=Montaldo}}</ref>
Sells claimed that when he was eight, he began spending time with a man named Willis Clark, who began to [[child molestation|molest]] him with the consent of his mother. Sells stated that this abuse affected him greatly, and he would relive his experiences while committing his crimes.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ugzyiC3z7Qo|title=YouTube|website=www.youtube.com|access-date=August 2, 2016}}</ref>
The homeless Sells hitchhiked and train-hopped across the United States from 1978 to 1999, committing various crimes along the way. He held several very short-term manual-labor and barber jobs. He drank heavily, [[Addiction|abused drugs]], and was [[Imprisonment|imprisoned]] [[recidivism|several times]].<ref name="CL5">{{cite web|first=David|last=Krajicek|url=http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/tommy_sells/5.html|title=A life of crime|website=[[TruTV|Crime Library]]|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407062153/http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/tommy_sells/5.html|archive-date=April 7, 2014}}</ref><ref> Michael H. Stone & Gary Brucato. The New Evil: Understanding the Emergence of Modern Violent Crime (Amherst, New York: Prometheus Books, 2019), pp. 180-184.</ref>
==Previous crimes, sentences, and mental disorders== In 1990, Sells stole a truck in [[Wyoming]] and was [[prison sentence|sentenced]] to 16 months' imprisonment. He was diagnosed with a [[personality disorder]] consisting of [[antisocial personality disorder|antisocial]], [[borderline personality disorder|borderline]], and [[schizoid personality disorder|schizoid]] features, [[substance use disorder]] (severe [[opioid]], [[cannabis]], [[amphetamine]]s, and [[alcoholism|alcohol dependence]]), [[bipolar disorder]], [[major depressive disorder]], and [[psychosis]].<ref name="CL6"/><ref name=TLS>{{cite web|first=Mike|last=Aamodt|title=Sells, Tommy Lynn|url=http://maamodt.asp.radford.edu/Psyc%20405/serial%20killers/Sells,%20Tommy%20Lynn%20-%202005.pdf|work=Department of Psychology|publisher=[[Radford University]]|location=Radford, Virginia|accessdate=April 23, 2014}}</ref>
On May 13, 1992, a 19-year-old woman in [[Charleston, West Virginia]], was driving when she saw Sells panhandling under an overpass with a sign that said, "I will work for food."<ref name="clark" /> She felt sorry for him and took him to her home, asking him to wait outside. She went into her home to get some food for him, and by the time she got back to her front door, he was inside. When she walked away to get something else, he got a knife from her kitchen and trapped her in a bedroom, and [[rape]]d her repeatedly.<ref name="clark" />
The woman fought back by hitting him in the head with a ceramic duck; in retaliation, Sells beat her with a piano stool. He also stabbed her 18 times.<ref name="CL6"/><ref name="clark" /> He was indicted on five counts of rape and felony assault in September 1992, but took a plea deal and pleaded guilty to [[Grievous bodily harm|malicious wounding]]. On June 25, 1993, he was sentenced to [[Indefinite imprisonment|2–⁠10 years' imprisonment]]; the rape charges were dropped.<ref name="clark" />
While serving this sentence, he was diagnosed with [[bipolar disorder]] and married Nora Price. He was released in 1997 and moved to [[Tennessee]] with his wife. He left her and resumed his cross-country travels.<ref name="CL6">{{cite web|first=David|last=Krajicek |url=http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/tommy_sells/6.html|title=Murder Interrupted|website=[[TruTV|Crime Library]]|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140403211417/http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/tommy_sells/6.html|archive-date=April 3, 2014|access-date=April 5, 2014}}</ref>
==Murders== Sells is believed by police to have murdered at least 22 people. Retired [[Texas Ranger Division|Texas Ranger]] John Allen said, "We did confirm 22... I know there's more. I know there's a lot more. Obviously, we won't ever know."<ref>{{cite web|agency=[[Associated Press]]|url=http://www.ksat.com/news/supreme-court-to-decide-tommy-lynn-sells-execution-drug-case/25298296|title=Supreme Court to decide Tommy Lynn Sells execution drug case|website=K-SAT.com|location=San Antonio, Texas|date=April 3, 2014|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407114622/http://www.ksat.com/news/supreme-court-to-decide-tommy-lynn-sells-execution-drug-case/25298296|archivedate=April 7, 2014}}</ref> Sells said he committed his first murder at age 15, after breaking into a house. While in the house, Sells claimed to have discovered a man performing [[fellatio]] on a boy and killed the man in a fit of rage.<ref name=TLS/>
In July 1985, 21-year-old Sells worked at a [[Forsyth, Missouri]], carnival, where he met 28-year-old Ena Cordt (November 15, 1956 – July 27, 1985) and her 4-year-old son Rory (August 3, 1980 – July 27, 1985).<ref name="encyclopedia">{{cite book|first=Michael|last=Newton|title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers|date=2006|publisher=[[Infobase Publishing]]|location=New York City|isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3|page=235|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA235&dq=Ena+Cordt+28&hl=en&sa=X&ei=q7iNUp2VEImqyQGF44HwAg&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q&f=false| edition=2| chapter=Sells, Tommy Lynn}}</ref> Cordt invited Sells to her home that evening. According to Sells, he had sex with her, fell asleep, and awoke to find her stealing from his backpack. He proceeded to beat Cordt to death with her son's baseball bat. He then murdered her son because the child was a potential witness. The bludgeoned bodies were found 3 days later, by which time Sells had left town.<ref name="encyclopedia"/>
Sells is linked to these crimes: * May 1987 murder of Suzanne Korcz (February 2, 1960 – disappeared & presumed dead May 1987) in [[New York (state)|New York]]<ref name="encyclopedia"/> * November 17, 1987, [[Dardeen family homicides|murders of four members of the Dardeen family]] in [[Illinois]]<ref name="southern">{{cite web|first=Tara|last=Fasol|title=Brutal Jefferson County murder still goes unsolved|work=thesouthern.com|url=http://thesouthern.com/news/article_51b2456d-80ff-5def-9511-6292e669c94e.html|date= January 12, 2008|accessdate=April 5, 2014}}</ref> * September 11, 1988, murder of Melissa Tremblay (March 1, 1977 – September 11, 1988) in [[Lawrence, Massachusetts]] * 1989 murder of a co-worker in Texas * October 13, 1997, murder of 10-year-old Joel Kirkpatrick in [[Lawrenceville, Illinois]]<ref name="mich">{{citeweb|url=https://www.law.umich.edu/special/exoneration/Pages/casedetail.aspx?caseid=3278| title=Julie Rea|publisher=National Registry of Exonerations|accessdate=December 11, 2018}}</ref> * November 18, 1997, murder of Stephanie Mahaney (June 20, 1984 – November 18, 1997) near [[Springfield, Missouri]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Sheriff Arnott to talk about killer with Ozarks ties|url=http://www.news-leader.com/story/news/local/ozarks/2014/04/02/sheriff-arnott-talk-killer-ozarks-ties/7220945|newspaper=[[Springfield News-Leader]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Springfield, Missouri|date=April 2, 2014|accessdate=April 2, 2014}}</ref> * April 18, 1999, murder of 9-year-old Mary Beatrice Perez (April 7, 1990 – April 18, 1999) in [[San Antonio]], Texas, a murder for which Sells was ultimately convicted<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://memim.com/tommy-lynn-sells.html|title=memim.com|website=memim.com|access-date=August 2, 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304091126/http://memim.com/tommy-lynn-sells.html|archivedate=March 4, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Death row inmate claims to know where missing Oklahoma girls are buried|newspaper=[[The Morning Sun]]|publisher=[[Gatehouse Media]]|location=Pittsburg, Kansas|date=May 15, 2002}}</ref> * May 23, 1999, sexual assault and murder of Haley McHone (August 14, 1985 – May 23, 1999) in [[Lexington, Kentucky]]<ref>{{cite web | title = Transcript: '20/20' interview with Tommy Lynn Sells|work=20/20|publisher=ABC News|year=2004|url=https://abcnews.go.com/2020/story?id=784420|accessdate=April 5, 2014}}</ref> * December 31, 1999, sexual assault and murder of Kaylene Jo "Katy" Harris (September 27, 1986 – December 31, 1999)<ref>{{Cite web|first=Drew|last=Joseph|url=https://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Killer-who-complained-about-execution-drug-is-put-5374770.php|title=Killer who complained about execution drug is put to death|newspaper=[[Houston Chronicle]]|publisher=[[Hearst Corporation]]|location=Houston, Texas|date=April 4, 2014|access-date=August 2, 2016}}</ref>
After watching an episode of ''[[Crime Watch Daily]]'' in November 2015, Melissa DeBoer ''née'' Tate, whose mother JoAnne Tate was murdered in 1982 and whose testimony as a 7 year old helped identify Rodney Lincoln as the killer, contacted authorities stating that she is now certain it was Sells, not Lincoln, who murdered her mother in 1982.{{cn|date=April 2020}}
==Arrests and confessions== [[File:PolunskyUnitWestLivingstonTX.jpg|thumb|Allan B. Polunsky Unit, where Sells was located]] On December 31, 1999, in the Guajia Bay subdivision, west of [[Del Rio, Texas]], Sells sexually assaulted, stabbed, and slit the throat of 13-year-old Kaylene "Katy" Harris, and slit the throat of 10-year-old Krystal Surles.<ref name="clark" /> Surles survived and received help from the neighbors after traveling a quarter-mile to their home with a severed trachea.<ref name="clark" /> Sells was apprehended after being identified from a [[facial composite|sketch]] made from the victim's description. Police over time came to suspect him of "working the system" by confessing to murders he had not committed.<ref name="mac"/>
The [[state's attorney]] in [[Jefferson County, Illinois]], declined to charge Sells with the Dardeen family homicides in 1987 because his confession to the quadruple killing, while generally consistent with the facts of the case as reported in the media, was inaccurate with concern to some details that had not been made public. He also changed his account three times regarding how he had met the family.<ref name="Dardeen case">{{cite news|last=Suhr|first=Jim|title=Unsolved 1987 slaying of Illinois family haunting|url=http://www.nwherald.com/2014/04/12/unsolved-1987-slaying-of-illinois-family-haunting/auj00b/|newspaper=[[Associated Press]]|via=[[Northwest Herald]]|date=April 12, 2014|accessdate=November 6, 2017}}</ref> Investigators wanted to bring Sells to [[southern Illinois]] to resolve their doubts, but Texas refused, due to its law forbidding [[death-row]] prisoners from leaving the state.<ref name="Texas not allowing him out of state">{{cite news|last=Gauen|first=Pat|title=Gruesome Illinois mystery appears to end with Texas execution|url=https://www.stltoday.com/news/local/columns/pat-gauen/gauen-gruesome-illinois-mystery-appears-to-end-with-texas-execution/article_b5a3da6c-c649-5725-8a7e-23f96873f514.html|newspaper=[[St. Louis Post-Dispatch]]|date=April 10, 2014|accessdate=November 8, 2017}}</ref>
Sells was housed on death row in the [[Allan B. Polunsky Unit]] near [[Livingston, Texas]]. The [[Texas Department of Criminal Justice]] received him on November 8, 2000.<ref>"[http://www.tdcj.state.tx.us/death_row/dr_info/sellstommy.html Tommy Sells profile], [[Texas Department of Criminal Justice]].</ref>
In 2004, Sells confessed that on October 13, 1997, he broke into a home, took a knife from a butcher block in the kitchen, stabbed a little boy to death, and scuffled with a woman. Those details corroborated the account of Julie Rea Harper, who was initially convicted for the murder of her son, and then acquitted in 2006.<ref name="mich"/><ref>{{Cite web|title = Julie Rea, Center on Wrongful Convictions: Bluhm Legal Clinic, Northwestern University School of Law|url = http://www.law.northwestern.edu/legalclinic/wrongfulconvictions/exonerations/il/julie-rea.html|website = www.law.northwestern.edu|accessdate = December 14, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = The end|url = http://illinoistimes.com/article-3319-the-end.html|website = illinoistimes.com|accessdate = December 14, 2015|language = en-US}}</ref>
==Execution== On January 3, 2014, a Del Rio judge set Sells' execution date for April 3, 2014.<ref name="executiondate">{{Cite web|url=http://www.kwtx.com/home/headlines/Execution-Date-Set-For-Texas-Inmate-Linked-To-A-Dozen-Slayings-238607271.html|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104055758/http://www.kwtx.com/home/headlines/Execution-Date-Set-For-Texas-Inmate-Linked-To-A-Dozen-Slayings-238607271.html|url-status=dead|title="Execution Date Set For Texas Inmate Linked To A Dozen Slayings"|archivedate=January 4, 2014}}</ref><ref>[http://www.newschannel10.com/story/25150023/serial-killer-executed-with-texas-new-drug-supply Execution date set for Tommy Sells], newschannel10.com; accessed April 5, 2014. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407070451/http://www.newschannel10.com/story/25150023/serial-killer-executed-with-texas-new-drug-supply |date=April 7, 2014 }}</ref> Sells' death sentence was carried out at the [[Huntsville Unit|Texas State Penitentiary]] in [[Huntsville, Texas|Huntsville]]. When asked if he would like to make a final statement, Sells replied, "No." As a lethal dose of [[pentobarbital]] was administered, he took a few deep breaths, closed his eyes, and began to snore. Less than a minute later, he stopped moving. Thirteen minutes later, at 6:27 pm ([[Central Time Zone#Central Daylight Time|CDT]]), he was pronounced dead.<ref name="executed">{{Cite web|url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news?ocid=ansnews11|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140406131024/http://news.msn.com/crime-justice/serial-killer-executed-with-texas-new-drug-supply?ocid=ansnews11|url-status=dead|title=Breaking News Stories from US and Around the World | MSN News|archivedate=April 6, 2014|website=www.msn.com}}</ref> Krystal Surles and members of both the Harris and Perez families attended the execution.<ref name="clark" />
== In media == Eight years before his execution, Sells was one of the featured interviewees on episode two ''("Cold-Blooded Killers")'' of season one on the [[Investigation Discovery]] documentary series, ''[[Most Evil]]''. The interview was done by [[forensic psychiatry|forensic psychiatrist]] Dr. Michael Stone. In the interview, Sells claimed to have killed more than 70 people.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.investigationdiscovery.com/tv-shows/most-evil/full-episodes/cold-blooded-killers| title=Most Evil: Cold Blooded Killers|date=February 28, 2007|accessdate=December 11, 2018|publisher=[[Investigation Discovery]]}}</ref> [[ABC News]] created a 10-minute mini-documentary 'Tommy Lynn Sells - The Mind of a Psychopath'.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6V7EL-Yg8Gg|title=Tommy Lynn Sells - The Mind of a Psychopath | Nightline | ABC News|date=August 26, 2010|via=YouTube}}</ref>
