{{short description|American serial killer on death row}} {{Infobox serial killer | name=Anthony Sowell | image=Anthony E. Sowell.jpg | caption=Sowell in the wanted flyer issued by the Cuyahoga County sheriff office, November 2009 | birth_name=Anthony Edward Sowell | birth_date={{Birth date and age|1959|08|19}} | birth_place= [[Ohio]], U.S. | death_date= | death_place= | cause= | victims=11 | country= [[United States]] | states= [[Ohio]] | beginyear=May 2007 | endyear=September 2009 | apprehended=October 31, 2009 | conviction = {{unbulleted list|11 counts of [[aggravated murder]]|3 counts of [[attempted murder]]|2 counts of [[kidnapping]]|4 counts of [[rape]]|1 count of [[attempted rape]]|11 counts of [[abuse of a corpse]]|11 counts of [[tampering with evidence]]}} | sentence = [[Capital punishment|Death sentence]] for murder. }}
'''Anthony Edward Sowell''' (born August 19, 1959) is an American [[serial killer]] known as the '''Cleveland Strangler'''. He was arrested in October 2009 after the bodies of eleven women were discovered by police investigators at his home, 12205 Imperial Avenue, in the Mount Pleasant neighborhood of [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]].<ref name="bodies">{{cite news| work=BBC News | url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/8335859.stm|title=Six bodies at US rapist's house |date=October 31, 2009 | accessdate=November 1, 2009}}</ref>
==Early life== Anthony Edward Sowell was raised in [[East Cleveland, Ohio|East Cleveland]], one of seven children born to single parent Claudia "Gertude" Garrison. Seven other children belonging to Sowell's sister also lived in the household, having moved in after her death following a chronic illness. According to Sowell's niece, Garrison subjected them to physical abuse while her own children watched from adjacent rooms. In one incident, Garrison forced Sowell's niece to strip naked in front of the other children, then whipped her with electrical cords until she bled. Sowell himself began raping his niece on an almost daily basis for two years, starting when she was 10.<ref>[http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/08/serial_killer_anthony_sowell_began_raping_niece_when_both_were_children_witness_testifies.html Serial killer Anthony Sowell began raping niece when both were children, witness testifies], Cleveland ''Plain-Dealer'', 2 August 2011</ref>
==Military service== On January 24, 1978, at the age of 19, Sowell entered the [[United States Marine Corps]]. He attended recruit training at [[Marine Corps Recruit Depot Parris Island]] in [[South Carolina]], then was further trained as an [[electrician]] at [[Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune|Camp Lejeune]] in [[North Carolina]]. On July 13, 1978, he was assigned to the [[2nd Marine Aircraft Wing]] at [[Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point]], also in North Carolina. In 1980, Sowell spent a year overseas with the [[3rd Marine Logistics Group|3rd Force Service Support Group]], then returned to Cherry Point.<ref name="marine"/>
He was then ordered to [[Marine Corps Base Camp Butler]] in [[Okinawa Prefecture|Okinawa]], [[Japan]] on January 20, 1984. A year later, he transferred to [[Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton|Camp Pendleton]] in [[California]] for three days until his discharge on January 18, 1985. During his seven-year Marine Corps career, Corporal Sowell received a [[Good Conduct Medal (United States)|Good Conduct Medal]] with one [[service star]], a [[Sea Service Ribbon|Sea Service Deployment Ribbon]], a Certificate of Commendation, a [[Mast (naval)|Meritorious Mast]], and two Letters of Appreciation.<ref name="marine">{{cite news|url=http://www.enctoday.com/news/serial-6305-havelock-killer-sowell.html |title=Marine Corps says accused serial killer stationed twice at Cherry Point and once at Camp Lejeune |work=[[Havelock, North Carolina|Havelock]] News |date=November 5, 2009 |accessdate=2009-11-05 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091109105933/http://www.enctoday.com/news/serial-6305-havelock-killer-sowell.html |archivedate=November 9, 2009 |df= }}</ref>
== 1989 attack, incarceration, and release == In 1989, Melvette Sockwell, who was three months pregnant, went to Sowell's home voluntarily. When she tried to leave, he bound her hands and feet with a tie and belt, then gagged her with a rag. The victim told police: "He choked me real hard because my body started tingling. I thought I was going to die."<ref name="skull"/> Sowell was charged with kidnapping, rape and attempted rape. He eventually plead guilty to the charge of attempted rape, and as a result he served 15 years in prison. He was released in 2005.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2009/11/anthony_sowell_was_considered.html|title=Anthony Sowell was considered unlikely to attack again in 2005 evaluation|date=2009-11-05|work=CBS News|accessdate=2009-11-05}}</ref>
Sowell worked in a factory until 2007 when he began collecting unemployment benefits.<ref name="skull"/> Neighbors said he earned a living selling scrap metal.<ref name="bodies"/> They complained to the health department of a foul smell in the neighborhood.<ref name="skull"/> He was a member of an online dating service, where he stated that he was a "master" looking for a submissive person to "train".<ref name="evenMoreBodies">{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/11/02/crimesider/entry5495923.shtml|title=Anthony Sowell Cruised Sex Fetish Site While Dead Bodies Rotted in His Cleveland Home|date=November 4, 2009|work=CBS News|accessdate=November 4, 2009 | first=Edecio | last=Martinez}}</ref>
Lori Frazier, a niece of Cleveland Mayor [[Frank G. Jackson]], began a relationship with Sowell shortly after his release from prison and resided in his home. She claims to have smelled the stench of decaying bodies and that she was told the smell was coming from Sowell's stepmother. When she moved out, she claimed that the smell was from Ray's Sausage Shop, located next door to the Sowell residence. There is some confusion about when Frazier stopped living in Sowell's home. In a video interview she mentions moving out in 2007, but in a published article she is said to have been living there until 2008.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2009/11/11/crimesider/entry5616478.shtml | work=CBS News | title=Mayor's Niece Lived With Alleged "Cleveland Strangler" Anthony Sowell and Rotting Bodies | first=Ryan | last=Smith | date=November 12, 2009}}</ref> Another article quotes a friend of Frazier's stating that Frazier stopped spending time at Sowell's home in 2008.<ref>Morris, Phillip. [http://www.cleveland.com/morris/index.ssf/2009/11/why_didnt_the_serial_killer_ki.html "Why didn't the serial killer kill her, she wonders?"], ''Cleveland.com'', 24 November 2009.</ref>
==Discovery of bodies and arrest== In September 2009,<ref name="marine"/> Sowell invited Latundra Billups to his home for a drink. On September 22, 2009, she reported to police that after a few drinks, he became angry, hit her, choked her and raped her as she passed out. On October 29, police arrived at his home with a warrant to arrest him for the alleged rape. He was not there, but he was located and arrested two days later.<ref name="marine"/>
The bodies of two women were buried in a shallow grave in the basement and four other women were found on the 3rd floor of the home, in crawl spaces in the house.<ref name="moreBodies">{{cite news | url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2009/11/crews_again_digging_at_anthony.html | title=Police discover 10 victims at Anthony Sowell's home | date=November 3, 2009 | work=Cleveland Metro | accessdate=November 3, 2009}}</ref> After digging in the backyard, investigators found three more bodies and the remains of a fourth. Police also found a human skull in a bucket inside the house, which brought the body count to eleven. Most of the victims were killed by manual strangulation and others were gagged or had ligatures on their bodies when they were discovered.<ref name="skull"/>
Sowell also had at least three more rape victims that he had actually let live. All three never reported the attacks, due to their prior drug history or other personal reasons. Many victims were led to his property with an invitation to smoke [[crack cocaine]] with him. He was a known drug user throughout his neighborhood.
At the time of his arrest, Sowell was 50 years old. He had been living at that location for four years.<ref name="skull">{{cite news | url = http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article6903700.ece | date = November 5, 2009 | title = Skull in a basket as police search Anthony Sowell's home for more bodies | work = The Times | accessdate = November 5, 2009 | location=London | first=James | last=Boneand}}</ref> He was held on $5 million bond.<ref name="ThreeMore"/> His trial was originally supposed to start on June 2, 2010<ref name="Anthony Sowell accused of killing">{{cite web|url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2010/05/anthony_sowell_accused_of_kill.html|title=Anthony Sowell accused of killing}}</ref> but was repeatedly delayed: first to September 7 to allow Sowell's attorneys more time to prepare,<ref name="Anthony Sowell accused of killing"/> then to February 14, 2011,<ref name="Trial for serial killing suspended">{{cite web|url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2011/01/trial_for_serial-killing_suspe.html|title=Trial for serial killing suspended}}</ref> then to May 2 at the request of Sowell's defense attorneys who needed more time to comb through thousands of records and hours of surveillance video footage shot from the property next door to Sowell's Imperial Avenue home, where the remains of 11 women were discovered in 2009,<ref name="Trial for serial killing suspended"/> and later to June 6 at the request of the prosecution due to scheduling conflicts.<ref name="Trial for serial killing suspended"/> The trial eventually began on June 6, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|first= Crow |last= Chuck | work=The Plain Dealer |url=http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/06/pleasant_conversations_with_anthony_sowell_turned_violent_without_warning_three_women_testify.html |title=Pleasant conversations with Anthony Sowell turned violent without warning, 3 women testify |publisher= cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first= Leila | last=Atassi |url= http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/suspected_serial-killer_anthony_sowell_told_police_he_punished_drug_addicted_women_interrogation_vid.html|title=Suspected serial killer Anthony Sowell told police he 'punished' drug-addicted women, interrogation video reveals |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first= Leila | last=Atassi |url=http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/anthony_sowell_hinted_at_yet_undiscovered_horrors_police_sergeant_testifies.html |title=Anthony Sowell hinted at yet undiscovered horrors, police sergeant testifies |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Scott | last= Shaw |work= The Plain Dealer |url=http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/anthony_sowell_trial_surviving_family_members_of_imperial_avenue_killings_recount_their_anguish.html |title=Anthony Sowell trial: Surviving family members of Imperial Avenue killings recount their anguish |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| first= Michael | last= Scott | work= The Plain Dealer |url=http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/more_grotesque_detail_expected_in_third_week_of_anthony_sowell_capital_murder_trial.html |title=More 'grotesque' detail expected in third week of Anthony Sowell capital murder trial |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Scott | last= Shaw |work= The Plain Dealer |url= http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/anthony_sowell_admitted_to_stashing_bodies_in_imperial_avenue_home_neighbor_testifies.html |title=Anthony Sowell admitted to stashing bodies in Imperial Avenue home, neighbor testifies |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Scott | last= Shaw |work= The Plain Dealer |url= http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/nurse_takes_stand_in_anthony_sowell_serial_murder_trial_describes_taking_dna_evidence.html |title=Nurse takes stand in Anthony Sowell serial murder trial, describes taking DNA evidence |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/news/crime/bodies_found/day-16-anthony-sowell-trial |title=Day 16: Anthony Sowell trial |publisher=Newsnet5.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150427143044/http://www.newsnet5.com/news/crime/bodies_found/day-16-anthony-sowell-trial |archivedate=2015-04-27 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first= Marvin |last= Fong |work= The Plain Dealer |url=http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/judge_acquits_serial-killings_defendant_anthony_sowell_on_2_of_85_counts_state_rests_its_case.html |title=Judge acquits serial-killings defendant Anthony Sowell on 2 of 85 counts, state rests its case |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first= Michael | last= Scott |url=http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/07/anthony_sowell.html |title=Week one of Anthony Sowell trial hard on victims' families: video interview with PD's Stan Donaldson |publisher=cleveland.com |work= The Plain Dealer| date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref>
==Conviction, sentencing, and appeals== Sowell was charged with eleven counts of [[aggravated murder]] and 74 counts of [[rape]], [[kidnapping]], [[tampering with evidence]], and [[abuse of a corpse]]. He pleaded [[not guilty by reason of insanity]] but later changed his plea to simply "not guilty."<ref>{{cite news | work=CNN | url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,571519,00.html | title='House of horrors' suspect due in court | date=March 24, 2010 | accessdate=March 24, 2010 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091107095409/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,571519,00.html | archive-date=November 7, 2009 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }}</ref> On July 22, 2011, he was convicted on all but two counts against him, including the murders of the eleven women whose bodies were found in his house in 2009. On August 10, jurors recommended the [[death penalty]] for Sowell.<ref>{{cite web | last = Scott | first = Michael | title =Cleveland serial killer Anthony Sowell's sentence: jury recommends death |work = The Plain Dealer | publisher = cleveland.com | date = 10 August 2011 | url = http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/index.ssf/2011/08/cleveland_serial_killer_anthony_sowells_sentence.html | accessdate = }}</ref> On August 12, Judge [[Dick Ambrose]] upheld the jury's recommendation.<ref>{{cite web | title =Anthony Sowell to die for murders of 11 women; judge accepts jury's advice |work = cleveland.com | publisher = | date = 12 August 2011 | url = http://www.cleveland.com/anthony-sowell/2011/08/cleveland_judge_sowell.html |accessdate=December 11, 2016}}</ref> Since September 14, 2011, Sowell has resided on death row at [[Chillicothe Correctional Institution]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction Offender Search Detail |publisher=Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction |url=https://appgateway.drc.ohio.gov/OffenderSearch/Search/Details/A604609?Enc=%7Csowell%7Canthony%7C%7C%7C%7CAll%7C%7CName%7C1%7C10%7C |accessdate=July 26, 2017}}</ref>
In November 2011, Sowell's lawyers, Jeffry F. Kelleher and Thomas Rein, filed a Notice of Appeal with the [[Supreme Court of Ohio]]. Sowell's execution was set for October 29, 2012, but in March 2012, a Motion for Stay of Execution was filed; the motion was granted in April, pending final disposition of the appeal.<ref>{{cite web |title=Case No. 2011-1921 Entry |publisher=Supreme Court of Ohio |date=April 2, 2012|url=http://supremecourt.ohio.gov/pdf_viewer/pdf_viewer.aspx?pdf=191130.pdf |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> In October 2012, Sowell's new lawyers, Jeffrey M. Gamso and Erika Cunliffe of the Cuyahoga County Public Defender's office, appealed to have his conviction and death sentence overturned on 21 points,<ref>{{cite web |title=APPELLANT'S REPLY BRIEF AND ASSIGNMENTS OF ERROR |publisher=Supreme Court of Ohio |date=April 25, 2013 |url=http://www.sconet.state.oh.us/pdf_viewer/pdf_viewer.aspx?pdf=726248.pdf |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> with the main three being:
*that Sowell did not receive a fair trial because of the extensive media coverage. The "media attention was overwhelming, generating thousands of news stories, and…local coverage was 'both frenzied and sustained.'"<ref name=Krouse2013>{{cite web |title =Anthony Sowell's attorneys dispute prosecutors' claims that serial killer got fair trial |work=Northeast Ohio Media Group |publisher=cleveland.com |date = April 26, 2013 |author=Peter Krouse |url = http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/04/anthony_sowells_attorneys_refu.html |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> *that the courtroom had been closed to the public "during an evidentiary hearing and while a jury was picked"<ref name=Dissell>{{cite web |title=Ohio Supreme Court asks whether Anthony Sowell's right to a public trial was violated, attorneys respond |work=The Plain Dealer |publisher=cleveland.com |date=October 3, 2014 |author=Rachel Dissell |url=http://www.cleveland.com/court-justice/index.ssf/2014/10/ohio_supreme_court_asks_whethe.html#incart_river_index |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> *and that he had received "lousy legal representation."<ref>{{cite web |title=Serial killer Anthony Sowell was given a fair trial, Cuyahoga County prosecutors claim in court filing |work=Northeast Ohio Media Group |publisher=cleveland.com |date=March 12, 2013 |author=Peter Krouse |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/03/serial_killer_anthony_sowell_was_given.html |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref> "Sowell's trial attorneys should have had their client plead guilty to killing the women and then focus their efforts on preventing Sowell from getting the death penalty."<ref name=Krouse2013 />
In September 2014, the court asked both parties to address three issues.<ref>{{cite web |title=Case No. 2011-1921 Entry |publisher=Supreme Court of Ohio |date=September 3, 2014 |url=http://supremecourt.ohio.gov/pdf_viewer/pdf_viewer.aspx?pdf=199920.pdf |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref>
On April 5, 2016, the Ohio Supreme Court heard arguments from Sowell's appellant attorneys and the Cuyahoga County D.A. representing the State of Ohio regarding the merits of the closed pre-trial Suppression Hearing prior to Sowell's trial, and the defendant's right to a fair and public trial. The attorneys representing Sowell argued that Sowell's [[Sixth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Sixth Amendment]] right was violated by closing the Suppression Hearing to the press, and that the Court should commute his Death Sentence to Life-In-Prison as a remedy to the structural error that resulted in the violation. They also argued that counsel had made errors, and "urged the Ohio Supreme Court to send the case back to Cuyahoga County for a retrial. 'Frankly we blew it,' attorney Jeffrey Gamso told the Ohio Supreme Court."<ref name=Borchardt>{{cite web |title=Anthony Sowell's lawyer asks Ohio Supreme Court to save his life |publisher=cleveland.com |date=April 5, 2016 |author=Jackie Borchardt |url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2016/04/anthony_sowell.html |accessdate=May 19, 2016}}</ref>
The State argued that if Sowell's Sixth Amendment right was violated via the closed pre-trial Suppression Hearing it would not have affected the outcome of the trial, as the evidence was overwhelming, and that "Sowell's attorneys were the ones who asked multiple times in his presence for the jury selection to be done privately, without cameras in the courtroom."<ref name=Dissell /> The State also asserted that Sowell has never denied his guilt, and that the heinous nature of his crimes—coupled with little mitigating evidence to deny imposing the death penalty—warrants affirming the death sentence.<ref name=Borchardt />
On December 8, 2016, the Ohio Supreme Court rejected an appeal from Anthony Sowell, affirming his aggravated murder convictions and death sentence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2016/12/ohio_supreme_court_upholds_con.html|title=Ohio Supreme Court upholds convictions of mass murderer Anthony Sowell|work=cleveland.com|date=December 8, 2016|accessdate=December 11, 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, Sowell appealed his case to the U.S. Supreme Court.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2017/05/anthony_sowell_appeals_case_to.html|title=Anthony Sowell appeals case to U.S. Supreme Court|work=cleveland.com|date=May 25, 2017|accessdate=June 1, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/anthony-sowell-notorious-cleveland-serial-killer-appeals-case-to-supreme-court/|title=Anthony Sowell, notorious Cleveland serial killer, appeals case to Supreme Court|work=CBS NEWS|date=May 23, 2017|accessdate=June 1, 2017}}</ref> In October 2017, the U.S. Supreme Court said that it would not review Sowell's appeal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/court-justice/index.ssf/2017/10/us_supreme_court_will_not_hear.html|title=U.S. Supreme Court will not hear Cleveland mass murderer Anthony Sowell's appeal|work=cleveland.com|date=October 2, 2017|accessdate=October 4, 2017}}</ref> In February 2018, the Ohio Supreme Court denied a request by Sowell to reopen his appeal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2018/02/ohio_supreme_court_wont_reopen.html|title=Ohio Supreme Court won't reopen Anthony Sowell appeal|work=cleveland.com|date=February 14, 2018|accessdate=February 19, 2018}}</ref>
==Victims== On November 5, 2009, two of the eleven victims were identified. The first to be identified was Tonia Carmichael, a 53-year-old [[African American]] woman who had disappeared more than a year earlier. Her body was found buried in his backyard. She appeared to have been strangled and was identified through the use of DNA evidence. Her mother had reported her missing in December 2008.<ref name="firstID">{{cite news | url= http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/2009/11/05/2009-11-05_police_id_first_of_11_victims_found_decomposing_in_anthony_sowells_cleveland_hom.html | title = Police ID first of 11 victims found decomposing in Anthony Sowell's Ohio home as Tonia Carmichael | date=November 5, 2009 | work=New York Daily News | accessdate=November 5, 2009 | first=Brian | last=Kates}}</ref>
The second victim was identified as Telacia Fortson, a 31-year-old African American woman who had disappeared five months earlier. Although she had been missing since June, her mother did not report her missing until she heard the news coverage regarding the dead bodies discovered in Sowell's home.<ref name="2ndVic">{{cite news | url = http://www.woio.com/Global/story.asp?S=11452010 | title = 2nd Victim: Cuyahoga County Coroner ID's Second Imperial Body | work = [[WIOO]] Action News | date = 5 November 2009 | accessdate = 2009-11-05 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20091108134441/http://www.woio.com/Global/story.asp?S=11452010# | archive-date = 2009-11-08 | url-status=dead | df = }}</ref>
On November 8, 2009, three more bodies were identified. Crystal Dozier was a 38-year-old African American woman who went missing in May 2007. Dozier, the mother of seven children, lived in the area where her body was discovered. Her family reported her missing to the Cleveland Police Department. This was not the first time she had gone missing, and the family accused the police of failing to investigate. The family took it upon themselves to post fliers and call hospitals.<ref name="ThreeMore">{{Cite news | last = Baird | first = Gabriel | title = Names put to three more victims in Anthony Sowell case | newspaper = The Plain Dealer | location = Cleveland, Ohio | publisher = Cleveland Live | date = 8 November 2009 | url = http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2009/11/names_put_to_three_more_victim.html | accessdate = 2009-11-09}}</ref>
Amelda "Amy" Hunter was a 47-year-old African American woman. Hunter, a beautician and a mother of three, did not live in the area where her body was found, but she did visit frequently. A previous injury left her unable to use one of her arms. Her family did not report her missing until after police began removing bodies from Sowell's house.<ref name="ThreeMore"/>
Michelle Mason was a 45-year-old African American woman who was last seen in October 2008. She lived in the area where her body was found. According to records, the police conducted a full investigation when her family reported her missing.<ref name="ThreeMore"/>
Records of missing persons going back to Sowell's June 2005 release from prison were searched and [[DNA testing]] was conducted on the bodies found at Sowell's house. Protesters holding posters of missing loved ones gathered outside his home at the time.<ref name="bodies"/>
[[East Cleveland, Ohio|East Cleveland]] police also reopened several [[cold case (criminology)|cold case]]s from the late 1980s. The murders by strangulation used a similar [[modus operandi]] and had stopped around 1989, the same time that Sowell was arrested.<ref>[http://www.wkyc.com/news/local/news_article.aspx?storyid=124851&catid=45 "East Cleveland: Did suspected serial killer also strike in 1989?"], [[WKYC]]-TV, 7 November 2009.</ref> The [[FBI]] at the time was gathering information to see if Sowell may have been linked to unsolved cases in cities where he once lived.<ref name="ThreeMore"/><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2009/11/09/2009-11-09_anthony_sowell_murder_case_goes_worldwide.html#ixzz0ctHtIHZ5 | location=New York | work=Daily News | title=Anthony Sowell rape and murder case goes international | first=Soraya | last=Roberts | date=9 November 2009}}</ref>

==Aftermath== After Sowell's conviction, in December 2011, Sowell's former residence at 12205 Imperial Avenue was demolished on the order of city leaders.<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2011/12/05/us/ohio-murder-house/index.html?hpt=hp_t3 Cleveland to demolish serial killer's home], CNN.com, 5 December 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.fox8.com/news/wjw-news-city-tearing-down-imperial-avenue-home,0,7063446.story Sowell's Imperial Avenue Home to be Demolished Tuesday] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111206124103/http://www.fox8.com/news/wjw-news-city-tearing-down-imperial-avenue-home%2C0%2C7063446.story |date=December 6, 2011 }}, WJW-TV, 5 December 2011</ref> Sowell resides on death row at [[Chillicothe Correctional Institution]].
==Media== ''House of Horrors: The Shocking True Story of Anthony Sowell, the Cleveland Strangler'', written by Cleveland-based journalist Robert Sberna, examines Sowell's crimes and profiles the 11 women he murdered and the six women who survived his attacks. The book was released in October 2012 by [[Kent State University Press]]. ''House of Horrors'' was named 2012 True Crime "Book of the Year" by ForeWord Reviews.<ref>[https://botya.forewordreviews.com/winners/2012/true-crime/ True Crime winners, 2012] at ForeWord Reviews</ref>
''Nobody's Women: The Crimes and Victims of Anthony Sowell, the Cleveland Serial Killer'' was written by Michigan-based crime author [[Steve Miller (author)|Steve Miller]]. The book details Sowell's murders and how he selected his victims. It was released in October 2012 by [[Penguin Publishing]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PZ-FtgAACAAJ |title=Nobody's Women: The Crimes and Victims of Anthony Sowell, the Cleveland Serial Killer |publisher=Google Books |date= |accessdate=2012-11-23}}</ref>
The case was profiled on the series premiere of the [[Investigation Discovery]] show ''Killer Instinct''.<ref>[http://www.freep.com/story/entertainment/television/2015/08/17/chris-hansen-killer-instinct/31843037/ MSU grad Chris Hansen returns with 'Killer Instinct'] ''Detroit Free Press'', August 17, 2015</ref>
''Unseen'', a documentary film about the victims and survivors of Sowell, was produced by Laura Paglin and released in 2016. The film, which premiered at the Cleveland International Film Festival, is distributed by [[FilmRise]].{{citation needed|date=June 2018}}
== Letter to the public == In November 2012. Anthony Sowell released a letter through the website [[Serial Killers Ink]].<ref>{{cite news|first=Dick |last=Russ |title=Anthony Sowell's 'artwork' for sale online |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269097/45/Anthony-Sowells-artwork-for-sale-online |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209091137/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269097/45/Anthony-Sowells-artwork-for-sale-online |url-status=dead |archive-date=February 9, 2013 |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012 }}</ref> The letter was to the people of Cleveland. Sowell railed against former trial judge and newly elected Cuyahoga County prosecutor Tim McGinty and addressed the issue of artwork which he had recently sent to the owner of the website.<ref>{{cite news |first=Peter |last=Krouse |title= Serial killer Anthony Sowell's artwork back on 'murderabilia' website |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/11/serial_killer_anthony_sowells.html |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Kevin |last=Freeman |title= Death Row Drawings: Sowell's Controversial Artwork is Selling |url=http://fox8.com/2012/11/13/death-row-drawings-sowells-controversial-artwork-is-selling/ |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Dick |last=Russ |title=Anthony Sowell 'artwork' buyer defends purchase |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269171/45/Anthony-Sowell-artwork-buyer-defends-purchase |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209074921/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/269171/45/Anthony-Sowell-artwork-buyer-defends-purchase |url-status=dead |archive-date=February 9, 2013 |date=November 12, 2010 |accessdate=November 13, 2012 }}</ref>

{{Infobox serial killer | name=Heriberto Seda | image = | image_size = | caption = | birthname= | alias=The Brooklyn Sniper
The Copycat Zodiac Killer
Faust
The New York [[Zodiac Killer]] | birth_date={{Birth date and age|1967|07|31}} | birth_place=[[New York City, New York]], U.S. | victims=3 killed, 5 wounded | country=United States | states=New York | beginyear=March 8, 1990 | endyear=October 2, 1993 | apprehended=June 18, 1996 | conviction=Attempted murder
Murder | sentence=232 years imprisonment }} '''Heriberto Seda''' (born July 31, 1967) is an American [[serial killer]] who struck [[New York City]] from 1990 to 1993. Before being caught on June 18, 1996, Seda killed three people and wounded five others (four critically). Seda is believed to have admired [[San Francisco]]'s [[Zodiac Killer]] for avoiding capture. Police described Seda, a Brooklyn resident, as a recluse obsessed with astrology and death. Seda was formally charged in the case on June 21, 1996, convicted in 1998, and sentenced to 232 years imprisonment. ==Crimes== Seda attacked people throughout New York City, sending taunting messages to the police and media after each crime. The messages included codes based on [[International maritime signal flags]], which ''[[New York Post]]'' journalist [[Kieran_Crowley_(writer) | Kieran Crowley]] decoded with the assistance of his father-in-law, a veteran of [[World War II cryptography]] and [[signals intelligence]].Crowley, Keiran (2003). ''Sleep My Little Dead: The True Story of the Zodiac Killer''. St Martin's Paperbacks The killer's letters to police claimed that he was selecting his victims based on their signs of the [[zodiac]], and implied he would act only at certain times when specific stars were visible in the night sky. Police consulted a professional astronomer, whose predictions about when the killer would strike proved somewhat accurate. He used an [[improvised firearm]], explaining in his messages that the lack of rifling marks on the shells would prevent his capture. New York police considered the possibility that the notorious [[Zodiac Killer]] may have relocated to the East Coast and resumed his crimes after two decades of inactivity. In the late 1960s the Zodiac Killer murdered at least five people and injured another two in the San Francisco area. He sent taunting letters and coded messages to local media, and was never identified. However, a handwriting analyst and consultation with California authorities ruled out that possibility. ==Capture== In March 1994, Seda was arrested for possession of a deadly weapon after police noticed a suspicious bulge in his jacket pocket that concealed one of his zip guns. Police determined that the weapon was not functional, and Seda's [[public defender]] managed to get all charges dropped and his arrest record sealed. Seda interpreted this turn of events as an [[omen]], proving that he was beyond consequences. At 26 years of age, Seda was an unemployed high school drop out, living with his mother and half-sister. He had been a good high school student, but was expelled after bringing a [[starter pistol]] to school. He had dropped out rather than attend mandatory counseling sessions to be readmitted to school. He was unemployed and supported by his mother, but obtained money by stealing coins from pay phones and vending machines. Seda was [[Psychological abuse|mentally]] and [[Physical abuse|physically abusive]] to his teenage half-sister, Gladys "Chachi" Reyes. During a confrontation with her and her boyfriend on June 18, 1996, Seda pulled out a weapon and began threatening the couple. While Reyes' boyfriend hid in the bedroom, she tried to escape through the front door, but Seda shot her in the buttocks. Wounded but not incapacitated, she made her way to her neighbor's apartment where she called the police. After an hours-long stand-off with the police, Seda gave up his firearms and was arrested.{{cite news |first= Lynda|last= Richardson|authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Suspect Is Charged in 4 Zodiac Cases in Queens |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9E03E6DC1539F931A15755C0A960958260 |work=[[New York Times]] |date=June 22, 1996 |accessdate=2008-07-07 }} ==Investigation and trial== Authorities initially made no connection between Seda's arrest for the family violence incident, and the string of unsolved murders. However, he closed his handwritten statement about the family incident with a symbol resembling one written on the taunting letters to the police by the unidentified killer. From here, police focused on Seda as a suspect. Despite the killer's claim that he could never be linked to the crimes due to the lack of rifling on the improvised guns, police were able to use tool-mark evidence to link Seda to the attacks. Fingerprint evidence was also found, and handwriting analysis determined a strong similarity between Seda's statement and the anonymous letters. Most damning, police found Seda's DNA on one of the stamps that had been used to mail a letter to police. Seda caused repeated disruptions in court, making outbursts and shouting at the judge.Vivian S. Toy (May 15, 1998). [https://www.nytimes.com/1998/05/15/nyregion/man-said-to-be-zodiac-killer-becomes-enraged-at-trial.html Man Said to Be Zodiac Killer Becomes Enraged at Trial], ''The New York Times''. Retrieved 25 March 2017 On June 24, 1998, Seda was convicted by a jury after a six-week trial, presided over by the Honorable Robert J. Hanophy, Justice of the State Supreme Court for the County of Queens, New York.{{cite news |last1=Toy |first1=Vivian S. |title=Brooklyn Man Is Guilty In Three Zodiac Killings |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1998/06/25/nyregion/brooklyn-man-is-guilty-in-three-zodiac-killings.html |accessdate=October 7, 2018 |work=New York Times |date=June 25, 1998}} The case was prosecuted by Assistant District Attorneys Robert J. Masters and Raymond E. Scheer. The prosecution presented testimony of 45 witnesses, and introduced 150 pieces of evidence. Seda was represented by court appointed attorneys David A. Bart and John S. Wallenstein. ==Victims== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" | ! Date !! Victim !! Zodiac Sign !! Status !! Description |- | March 8, 1990 || Mario Orozco|| [[ Scorpio (astrology)|Scorpio]] || {{Yes|Survived}} || Shot in the back. The bullet stayed lodged next to his spine.{{cite news |first= N.|last= Kleinfeld|authorlink= |coauthors= |title=THE TRAIL OF 'THE ZODIAC': THE OVERVIEW;Police Say Zodiac Suspect Admits Attacks That Killed 3 and Hurt 5 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/06/20/nyregion/trail-zodiac-overview-police-say-zodiac-suspect-admits-attacks-that-killed-3.html |work=[[New York Times]] |date=June 20, 1996 |accessdate=2017-02-26 }} |- | March 29, 1990 || Jermaine Montenesdro ||[[Gemini (astrology)|Gemini]] || {{Yes|Survived}} || Shot in the left torso of his lower body. The bullet went through his liver. |- | May 31, 1990 || Joseph "Joe" Proce || [[Taurus (astrology)|Taurus]] || {{no|Died}} || Shot in his lower back, hitting his kidney. He survived the attack, but died in the hospital on June 24, 1990{{cite news |first= Jack|last= Curry|authorlink= |coauthors= |title=3 Weeks Later, A Victim Shot By 'Zodiac' Dies |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C0CE6DD1730F936A15755C0A966958260 |quote=The gunman who calls himself Zodiac became responsible for his first death yesterday morning when his third shooting victim, a 78-year-old man, died at Jamaica Hospital, the police said. Joseph Proce was shot in the back about 2 A.M. on May 31 as he walked in front of 74-27 87th Road in Woodhaven, Queens, the police said. Mr. Proce later told the police that the gunman asked him for a glass of water and then shot him in the back as he walked away.|work=[[New York Times]] |date=June 25, 1990 |accessdate=2008-07-07 }} |- | June 19, 1990 || Larry Parham || [[Cancer (astrology)|Cancer]] || {{Yes|Survived}} || Shot in the chest. The bullet missed his aorta and exited his body through his right armpit. |- | August 10, 1992 || Patricia Fonte ||[[Leo (astrology)|Leo]] || {{no|Died}} || Shot twice and then was stabbed over 100 times. |- | June 4, 1993 || James "Jim" Weber ||[[Libra (astrology)|Libra]]|| {{Yes|Survived}} || Shot in the buttocks. |- | July 20, 1993 || John DiAcone ||[[Virgo (astrology)|Virgo]] ||{{no|Died}} || Shot in the head at close range. |- | October 2, 1993 || Diane Ballard ||[[Taurus (astrology)|Taurus]]|| {{Yes|Survived}} || Shot in the neck. The bullet missed vital arteries but lodged against her spine. |} ==Personal life== In prison, Seda began a romantic affair with Synthia-China Blast, a trans woman who is serving a sentence for a gang-related murder.Haynes, Esther. [http://nymag.com/nymetro/news/crimelaw/features/n_10181/ Kiss of the Scorpion Woman], ''[[New York Magazine]]'' (publ. Apr. 9, 2004) == See also == * [[List of fugitives from justice who disappeared]] * [[List of serial killers in the United States]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20141104054829/http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/weird/seda/seda_5.html Heriberto Seda] at the [[Crime Library]] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Seda, Heriberto}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:1990 murders in the United States]] [[Category:American people convicted of attempted murder]] [[Category:American people convicted of murder]] [[Category:American prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment]] [[Category:American serial killers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male serial killers]] [[Category:People convicted of murder by New York (state)]] [[Category:People from Brooklyn]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment by New York (state)]] [[Category:Zodiac Killer]]

{{Infobox serial killer | name=Auto Shankar | image= | caption= | | alias= | birth_date={{Birth date|1954|1|21}} | birth_place=[[Kangeyanallur]], [[Vellore District]], India | death_date={{Death date and age|1995|4|27|1954|1|21}} | cause=hanging - death penalty | victims=6 | country=[[India]] | states= | beginyear=1975 | endyear=1989 | apprehended= | penalty=[[Capital punishment|Death]] }}
'''Auto Shankar''' (January 21, 1954 – April 27, 1995) is the [[nickname]] of [[India]]n [[serial killer]] '''Gowri Shankar'''.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Thomas|first1=K.M.|title=The mass murderer of Madras|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=EoZlAAAAIBAJ&sjid=mZ4NAAAAIBAJ&dq=auto%20shankar&pg=1032%2C3469058|accessdate=2 January 2013|agency=[[The Indian Express]]|date=9 September 1990}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Auto Shankar, two others sentenced to death|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=PIxlAAAAIBAJ&sjid=q54NAAAAIBAJ&pg=817%2C2582855|accessdate=2 January 2013|agency=[[The Indian Express]]|date=1 June 1991}}</ref>
==Murders== Shankar and his gang, consisting of his younger brother Auto Mohan and associates Eldin and Shivaji, as well as Jayavelu, Rajaraman, Ravi, Palani and Paramasivam, were found guilty of six murders, committed over a period of two years in 1988–1989.<ref name="Brother">[http://www.hindu.com/2005/11/26/stories/2005112620501000.htm The Hindu : Auto Shankar's brother gets life imprisonment]</ref> They were tried for the murders of Lalitha, Sudalai, Sampath, Mohan, Govindaraj and Ravi.<ref name="Brother" /> The bodies of the victims were either burnt or buried inside residential houses.<ref name="Brother" />
==Trial== Shankar's trial was held at the [[Chengalpattu]] sessions court.<ref name="Brother" /> He was [[death penalty|sentenced to death]] along with two of his associates, Eldin and Shivaji, on May 31, 1991.<ref name="Brother" /> Auto Shankar was [[hanging|hanged]] in Salem Central Prison.<ref name="Brother" />
==Associates==
In 1992, Shankar's five accomplices were sentenced to six months of Rigorous Imprisonment after having been found guilty by a [[Magistrate]].<ref name="RI">[http://www.hinduonnet.com/2002/05/05/stories/2002050501780400.htm The Hindu : RI for jail wardens in 'Auto' Shankar case]</ref> The accomplices were Shankar's brother, Mohan, Selva (alias Selvaraj) and the jail wardens Kannan, Balan and Rahim Khan.<ref name="RI" /> They were found guilty of ''criminal conspiracy'' and ''resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension''.<ref name="RI" />
Subsequently, Mohan was also found guilty of the six murders and was given three [[life sentence]]s.<ref name="Brother" /> Mohan had escaped from the [[Chennai Central Prison]] in August 1990 and was captured in [[Pune]] on June 25, 1992.<ref name="Brother" />
==Responses== [[K. Vijay Kumar]], the Tamil Nadu Additional Director-General of Police, claimed that cinema was solely responsible for making Shankar a criminal.<ref name="Vijay">[http://www.hindu.com/2007/03/05/stories/2007030503780300.htm The Hindu : Media, police should not harm society's interests]</ref> He mentioned this during a seminar on "Crime and Media" in [[Kerala]].
The trial has become widely known across the nation since the Supreme Court invoked the American [[free speech]] doctrine and the case became oft-quoted in relation to journalistic [[investigative journalism|exposés]].<ref>[http://www.hindu.com/2003/12/12/stories/2003121201851200.htm The Hindu : Whistles, stings and slapps]</ref><ref>[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/2001/09/07/stories/05072523.htm The Hindu : Tehelka: what next?]</ref><ref>[http://www.hindu.com/2004/10/15/stories/2004101500821000.htm The Hindu : The Tehelka Commission]</ref>
==Popular Culture== The 1990 [[Tamil language]] film ''[[Pulan Visaranai]]'' directed by [[R. K. Selvamani]] was partially inspired by Auto Shankar's crimes.<ref>http://www.bbthots.com/reviews/rewind/pvisaaranai.html</ref> A television series based on his life was aired on Makkal TV.<ref>http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-features/tp-metroplus/The-Radha-MGR-episode/article15386008.ece</ref> [[Crime Patrol (TV series)|Crime Patrol]] aired an episode on Sony TV based on the story of Auto Shankar in February 2018. A 2019 Tamil web series produced by [[ZEE5]] is also based on him.<ref name="statesman">{{Cite news |url=https://www.thestatesman.com/entertainment/auto-shankar-zee5-web-series-serial-killer-gowri-shankar-premiers-23-april-1502743465.html |title=Auto Shankar: ZEE5 web series on serial killer Gowri Shankar premiers on 23 April |date=6 April 2019 |work=[[The Statesman (India)|The Statesman]] |access-date=7 April 2019}}</ref>

July 29, 2015 |conviction = [[Murder]] |sentence = |spouse = }} '''Tamara Mitrofanovna Samsonova''' ({{lang-ru|Тама́ра Митрофа́новна Самсо́нова}}; born February 5, 1947 in [[Uzhur]], [[Krasnoyarsk Krai]]), known as the "Granny Ripper" and "[[Baba Yaga]]",<ref name=taa>{{Citeweb|url=http://lenta.ru/articles/2015/08/08/samsonova/|title=Baba Yaga from Dimitrov Street: about a retired Petersburg woman who turned into a popular monster|author=Sergey Lyutykh|publisher=[[Lenta.ru]]|date=8 August 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160530122051/https://lenta.ru/articles/2015/08/08/samsonova/|archive-date=30 May 2016|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=of>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.rosbalt.ru/piter/2015/07/29/1424000.html|title="Diary of Death" Kupchinskaya grandmother|author=Alexander Kalinin|publisher=Rosbalt|date=29 July 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181215065822/http://www.rosbalt.ru/piter/2015/07/29/1424000.html|archive-date=15 December 2018|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=dam>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.gazeta.ru/social/2015/07/29/7662109.shtml|title=Tamara the Ripper|author=Sophia Savina|publisher=Gazeta.ru|date=29 July 2015|language=Russian|access-date=7 August 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150808194018/http://www.gazeta.ru/social/2015/07/29/7662109.shtml|archive-date=8 August 2015|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=ya>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.ntv.ru/novosti/1489756/|title=She did not described the murders: the diary of the St. Petersburg dismemberment was at the disposal of NTV|author=Alexey Kobylkin|publisher=[[NTV (Russia)|NTV]]|date=28 August 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181215121612/https://www.ntv.ru/novosti/1489756/|archive-date=15 December 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> is a Russian [[serial killer]] who was arrested in July 2015 on suspicion of committing 2 murders with extreme cruelty.<ref name="Independent">{{cite news |author=Siobhan Fenton |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/russian-pensioner-tamara-samsonova-may-have-eaten-victims-10442111.html |title=Russian pensioner Tamara Samsonova may have eaten victims - Europe - World |newspaper=The Independent |date=2015-08-06 |accessdate=2015-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150809010134/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/russian-pensioner-tamara-samsonova-may-have-eaten-victims-10442111.html |archive-date=2015-08-09 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.es/internacional/20150806/abci-youtube-abuela-destripadora-rusia-201508061303.html |title=YouTube - Tamara Samsonova, la "abuela destripadora" que mata, descuartiza y se come a sus víctimas |publisher=ABC.es |date=2015-08-06 |accessdate=2015-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150809060033/http://www.abc.es/internacional/20150806/abci-youtube-abuela-destripadora-rusia-201508061303.html |archive-date=2015-08-09 |url-status=live }}</ref> She supposedly suffers from [[schizophrenia]] and was previously hospitalized three times in psychiatric hospitals.<ref name=dam/><ref name="Gazeta">{{cite news | url=http://www.gazeta.ru/social/2015/07/29/7662109.shtml | title=Тамара-потрошительница | date=29 July 2015 | agency=[[Gazeta.ru]] | accessdate=August 7, 2015 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150808194018/http://www.gazeta.ru/social/2015/07/29/7662109.shtml | archive-date=8 August 2015 | url-status=live }}</ref>
==Biography== Samsonova was born on April 25, 1947, in the city of Uzhur, now part of the Krasnoyarsk Krai.<ref name=of/>
After graduating from high school, she arrived in Moscow and entered the [[Moscow State Linguistic University]]. After graduating, she moved to [[St. Petersburg]], where she married Alexei Samsonov. In 1971, she and her husband settled in the newly built panel house number 4 on Dimitrov Street.<ref name=of/><ref>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.mk.ru/incident/2015/07/30/potroshitelnica-mitrofanovna-sosedi-rasskazali-o-zhizni-manyachki-iz-pitera.html|title=Aunt Toma's hut|author=Svetlana Samodelova|publisher=[[Moskovskij Komsomolets]]|date=31 July 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180716063327/http://www.mk.ru/incident/2015/07/30/potroshitelnica-mitrofanovna-sosedi-rasskazali-o-zhizni-manyachki-iz-pitera.html|archive-date=16 July 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
For some time she worked for [[Intourist]] travel agency, in particular, in the [[Grand Hotel Europe]]. The amount of work experience Samsonova gathered at the time of her retirement was 16 years.<ref>{{Citeweb|url=http://lifenews.ru/news/158336|title=The Granny Ripper was educated at an elite university in Moscow|author=Alexey Kobylkin|publisher=[[Life (news agency, Russia)|Life]]|date=28 August 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160316140100/http://lifenews.ru/news/158336|archive-date=16 March 2016|url-status=live}}</ref>
In 2000, Samsonova's husband disappeared (she supposedly killed him and got rid of the body). She appealed to the police, but subsequent searches yielded nothing. Fifteen years later, in April 2015, she turned towards the authorities again, this time to the investigative unit of the Fruzensky District in St. Petersburg, giving a statement about her spouse's disappearance.<ref name=ya/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.torontosun.com/2015/08/05/suspected-serial-killing-granny-may-have-eaten-parts-of-her-victims |title=Suspected serial killing granny may have eaten parts of her victims | World | Ne |publisher=Torontosun.com |date=2015-08-05 |accessdate=2015-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150805200851/http://www.torontosun.com/2015/08/05/suspected-serial-killing-granny-may-have-eaten-parts-of-her-victims |archive-date=2015-08-05 |url-status=live }}</ref>
==Murders== After her husband's disappearance, Samsonova began renting out a room in her apartment. According to investigators, on September 6, 2003, during a quarrel, she killed her tenant. He was a 44-year-old resident from [[Norilsk]]. She then dismembered his corpse and disposed of it on the street.<ref name=taa/><ref name=ya/><ref name=wo>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.interfax.ru/russia/456754|title=Investigators in St. Petersburg asked not to rush to assign a series of murders to the pensioner|publisher=[[Interfax]]|date=29 July 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180525181713/http://www.interfax.ru/russia/456754|archive-date=25 May 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
In March 2015 Samsonova met 79-year-old Valentina Nikolaevna Ulanova who also lived on Dimitrov Street. A friend of the two asked Ulanova to shelter Samsonova for a time due to the fact that Samsonova's apartment was being renovated, to which Ulanova agreed. Samsonova lived in Ulanova's apartment for several months, helping with the housework. She began to like living in the apartment, wanting to stay there for longer and refusing to move out. Over time the relationship between the two deteriorated, and Ulanova eventually asked Samsonova to leave.<ref>{{Citeweb|url=http://lifenews.ru/news/160971|title=The Granny Ripper showed how she dismembered her friend|publisher=Life|date=7 September 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160316195909/http://lifenews.ru/news/160971|archive-date=16 March 2016|url-status=live}}</ref>
After another conflict, she decided to poison Ulanova. Samsonova travelled to [[Pushkin, Saint Petersburg|Pushkin]], where she managed to persuade a pharmacist to sell her a prescription drug, [[phenazepam]]. Upon returning to the city, she bought an [[Olivier salad]], one of Ulanova's favorite dishes, then put the pills in the salad and gave it to the unsuspecting woman.<ref name=po>Supposedly she had eaten body parts of her victims but if hasn't been proven yet. {{Citeweb|url=http://lifenews.ru/news/160971|title=The Granny Ripper showed how she dismembered her friend|publisher=Life|date=7 September 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160316195909/http://lifenews.ru/news/160971|archive-date=16 March 2016|url-status=live}}</ref>
Samsonava later found Ulanova's body lying on the kitchen floor on the night of July 23 and proceeded to dismember it with two knives and a saw. Firstly sawing off the victims head, she then sawed the body in half and then using the knives, she sheared it into pieces.<ref name=wo/> To take out all the bags outside of the apartment, she had to go outside and return several times. Samsonova left other parts of the body scattered around the house.<ref name=ya/><ref name=po/>
On the evening of July 26, Ulanova's decapitated body with severed limbs, wrapped in a bathroom curtain,<ref name=dam/> was found near a pond located house number 10 on Dimitrov Street. The package initially didn't attract any attention for several days, until a local resident took an interest in its contents.<ref>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.fontanka.ru/2015/07/26/086/|title=A decapitated body with severed limbs was found on Dimitrov Street|publisher=Fontanka.ru|date=26 July 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180412080537/http://www.fontanka.ru/2015/07/26/086/|archive-date=12 April 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
The identity of the deceased was established on July 27, after a survey of apartment residents. When they knocked on Ulanova's apartment, Samsonova opened the door to the authorities. Having entered inside, police officers found traces of blood in the bathroom, and also fastening from the torn off curtain. After this, the pensioner was immediately arrested.<ref name=dam/><ref name="MT">{{cite news |url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/elderly-russian-woman-suspected-of-multiple-macabre-murders-dismemberments/526443.html |title=Elderly Russian Woman Suspected of Multiple Macabre Murders, Dismemberments | News |newspaper=The Moscow Times |date=2015-07-29 |accessdate=2015-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150802023713/http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/elderly-russian-woman-suspected-of-multiple-macabre-murders-dismemberments/526443.html |archive-date=2015-08-02 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=f>{{Citeweb|url=http://ria.ru/incidents/20150729/1152967122.html|title=A St. Petersburg court arrested a pensioner suspected of cruel murder|publisher=[[RIA Novosti]]|date=29 July 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151223053912/http://ria.ru/incidents/20150729/1152967122.html|archive-date=23 December 2015|url-status=live}}</ref>
===Investigation and compulsory treatment=== On July 29, 2015, Samsonova was brought to the Frunze District Court of St. Petersburg, with the court issuing an order to detain her.<ref name=f/>
She was forced to take a forensic psychiatric exam, and on November 26, 2015, the results determined that she was a danger to society and herself, and therefore she was placed in a specialized institution until the end of the investigation.<ref>{{Citeweb|url=http://tass.ru/proisshestviya/2474053|title=A retired woman, to whom the media has attributed more than 10 murders, was placed in a psychiatric hospital|publisher=[[TASS]]|date=26 November 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181215123144/https://tass.ru/proisshestviya/2474053|archive-date=15 December 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
In December 2015, Samsonova was sent for compulsory psychiatric treatment in a specialized hospital in [[Kazan]].<ref>{{Citeweb|url=http://www.rosbalt.ru/piter/2015/12/09/1469679.html|title=Grandmother-warder from St. Petersburg is transferred to Kazan|publisher=Rosbalt|date=9 December 2015|language=Russian|access-date=14 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181215065808/http://www.rosbalt.ru/piter/2015/12/09/1469679.html|archive-date=15 December 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
She is being investigated in connection to a total of 14 murders.<ref name="MT"/>
According to media reports, police found a diary which contained details of some of the murders. One entry, translated from Russian to English, read: “I killed my tenant Volodya, cut him to pieces in the bathroom with a knife and put the pieces of his body in plastic bags and threw them away in the different parts of [[Frunzensky District, Saint Petersburg|Frunzensky District]].”<ref name="Independent"/>

{{more citations needed|date=July 2019}} {{Infobox serial killer |name=Anatoly Slivko
Анатолий Сливко |image=Anatoly Slivko.jpg |image_size= |caption= |birthname=Anatoly Yemelianovich Slivko |alias= |birth_date={{Birth date|1938|12|28}} |birth_place=[[Izerbash]], [[Dagestan Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic]], [[Soviet Union]] |death_date={{Death date|1989|9|16}} (age 50) |death_place=[[Novocherkassk]], [[Russian SFSR]], Soviet Union |cause=[[Execution by shooting]] |victims=7 |motive = [[Sexual sadism disorder|Sexual sadism]] |country=Soviet Union |states= |beginyear=June 2, 1964 |endyear=July 23, 1985 |apprehended=December 28, 1985 |sentence=[[Death penalty]] }} '''Anatoly Yemelianovich Slivko''' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: Анатолий Емельянович Сливко; December 28, 1938 – September 16, 1989) was a [[USSR|Soviet]] [[serial killer]], convicted of killing seven teenage boys in and around [[Nevinnomyssk]], [[Stavropol Krai]], [[Russian SFSR]], between 1964 and 1985.''Hunting The Devil'' p. 160 Over a two decade-long period, Slivko [[molested]] young boys at his youth club after tricking them into [[unconsciousness]], killing some of them in an attempt to recreate the violent death of a teenage boy he had witnessed in 1961, which had [[sexual arousal|sexually aroused]] him.''Hunting The Devil'' p. 163 Slivko was [[Capital punishment in the Soviet Union|executed]] by [[Execution by shooting#Soviet Bloc|shooting]] on 16 September 1989.''Hunting The Devil'' pp. 162 == Background == Anatoly Yemelianovich Slivko was born on 28 December 1938 in [[Izerbash]], [[Dagestan ASSR]], [[Soviet Union]]. He lived in [[Stavropol]] and was a married father of two children, although he had known himself to be [[homosexual]] since puberty.''The Killer Department'' p. 131 In 1961, Slivko witnessed a traffic accident in which a drunken motorcyclist had swerved into a group of pedestrians, fatally injuring a boy in his early teens who was wearing a [[Young Pioneer organization of the Soviet Union|Young Pioneers]] uniform.''Born to Kill in the USSR'' p. 61 For reasons Slivko would later insist he never could explain, this scene had [[sexual arousal|sexually excited]] him. He later recalled the accident vividly: "The boy had experienced [[convulsion]]s in his death throes as the smell of gasoline and fire permeated the air."''The Killer Department'' p. 131 Beginning in 1963, Slivko exploited his position at a children's club he ran to relive the fantasies of this accident.''Born to Kill in the USSR'' p. 65 Once or twice a year, he would form a close friendship with a boy who was usually aged between 12 and 15 and never older than 17.{{refn|group=n|Following his arrest, Slivko stated to investigators he never selected a youth older than 17 both because the boy killed in the 1961 traffic accident which had sparked his fantasies had been in his early teens, and out of concerns regarding the victim's physical strength.''The Killer Department'' p. 133}} The boy would be short for his age and would be wearing a Young Pioneers uniform - just like the boy Slivko had seen die in the traffic accident. Slivko would gain the boy's confidence and tell him of an experiment he knew which involved a controlled [[hanging]] to stretch the [[Vertebral column|spine]], and that he would reenact the scene of a [[Soviet partisans|partisan]] executed by Nazi soldiers for his children's club in order to film this scene,''Hunting The Devil'' p. 160 after which, the boy was assured, Slivko would revive him from his state of [[unconsciousness]].''The Killer Department'' p. 132 Prior to each boy undertaking this "experiment", Slivko would purchase a new uniform for the victim to wear and shine his shoes. In addition, to prevent any vomiting, the victim was required not to eat for several hours before the experiment.''Born to Kill in the USSR'' [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=qX0gAwAAQBAJ&pg=PA325&dq=Born+to+Kill+in+the+USSR&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CBwQ6AEwAGoVChMIwq-XvcDtyAIVgi4aCh1mFA6o#v=onepage&q=slivko&f=false p. 67] Once the boy was unconscious, Slivko would strip him naked, caress and fondle him, take films in which he would arrange the body in suggestive positions, and repeatedly [[masturbate]].''Hunting The Devil'' p. 164 == Murders == Over the course of 22 years, Slivko persuaded 43 boys to take part in this contrived experiment. In 36 cases, following his established ritual of [[photography]], filming, and repeated masturbation, Slivko revived these boys. Cautioned by Slivko into silence, these individuals resumed their lives unaware of what had happened to them whilst they had been unconscious.''The Killer Department'' p. 162 However, in seven cases, Slivko's behavior became violent: once these victims were unconscious, he [[dismembered]] their bodies, poured [[gasoline]] on their limbs and torso, and set the remains on fire to remind himself of the traffic accident which had sparked his arousal. Slivko typically retained the victim's shoes as a [[Souvenir|memento]], as well as the photographs and films which he developed in a home laboratory.''The Killer Department'' p. 132 The pictures and films served as stimuli for Slivko's masturbatory fantasies for months or years until he needed fresher stimuli and killed again.''Hunting the Devil'' p. 164 On June 2, 1964, Slivko killed his first victim, a 15-year-old runaway boy named Nikolai Dobryshev.''Born to Kill in the USSR'' p. 65 Slivko claimed this particular victim was killed unintentionally, as he had been unable to revive Dobryshev once he was unconscious. He dismembered the boy's body and [[Burial|buried]] him, also destroying the film and photographs he had taken of this particular victim. In May 1965, Slivko killed his second victim, Aleksei Kovalenko. Slivko began operating a tourist club for boys named Chergid in 1966, after his first club had been destroyed in a fire. Eight years later, on November 14, 1973, a 15-year-old boy named Aleksander Nesmeyanov disappeared in [[Nevinnomyssk]], [[Stavropol Krai]]. Two years later, on May 11, 1975, an 11-year-old boy named Andrei Pogasyan disappeared. Pogasyan's mother told the police that a man had shot a film in a nearby forest and that her son was going to participate. However, the police did nothing to prevent this because they knew Slivko, who had won awards for other, more innocuous films. In 1980, a 13-year-old boy named Sergei Fatsiyev, who along with Nesmeyanov and Pogasyan was a member of Chergid, disappeared. The next victim was a fifteen-year-old named Vyacheslav Khovistik, who was killed in 1982. On July 23, 1985, Slivko killed his final victim, a 13-year-old boy named Sergei Pavlov, who disappeared after telling a neighbor he was going to meet the leader of Chergid. == Arrest == In November 1985, [[prosecutor]] Tamara Languyeva investigated Pavlov's disappearance and took an interest in Chergid's activities. However, she had no evidence of anything illegal in the way the club was run. Languyeva questioned many boys who had belonged to the club, who said they had suffered "temporary [[amnesia]]" and that Slivko had performed many experiments with them.http://www.1tv.ru/sprojects_edition/si5937/fi26843 Following a long inquiry, Slivko was arrested at his [[Stavropol]] home in December 1985. He would later be formally accused of seven murders, seven counts of [[sexual abuse]], and seven counts of [[necrophilia]]. In early 1986, he led investigators to the bodies of six of his victims, although he was unable to locate the body of his first victim, Nikolai Dobryshev. In June 1986, he was [[death penalty|sentenced to death]] and placed on [[death row]] in [[Novocherkassk]] prison. In 1989, Slivko was asked by the police to help arrest a then-unidentified serial killer of [[Rostov Oblast]] who had killed a minimum of 29 victims by the time he was approached.''The Worst People in History'' p. 147 Although Slivko did provide some insight into how offenders such as himself were able to function, much of the actual advice he provided to police would prove to be incorrect.''The Killer Department'' pp. 133-134 The then-unidentified serial killer, [[Andrei Chikatilo]], was arrested in 1990 and would be convicted of killing 52 women and children.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=886&dat=19921015&id=rrE0AAAAIBAJ&sjid=qn0DAAAAIBAJ&pg=4816,1957003&hl=en/|title=Soviet serial killer is sentenced to life term|publisher=The Prescott Courier|date=15 October 1992|access-date=15 January 2017}} == Execution == On September 16, 1989, just hours after he was interviewed by the police, Slivko was [[death penalty|executed]] by [[execution by shooting|shooting]].''Born to Kill in the USSR'' p. 75 ==See also== {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * [[Capital punishment in the Soviet Union]] * [[Crime in the Soviet Union]] {{col-break}} * [[List of serial killers by number of victims]] {{col-end}} {{Portal bar|Biography|Law|Soviet Union}} ==Notes== {{reflist|group=n}} == References == {{Reflist|2}} ==Further reading== * Cullen, Robert (1993). ''The Killer Department: Detective Viktor Burakov's Eight-Year Hunt for the Most Savage Serial Killer of Our Times''. Orion Media. {{ISBN|1-85797-210-4}} * Kalman, Robert (2014). ''Born to Kill in the USSR''. Friesen Press. {{ISBN|978-1-460-22731-2}} * Lourie, Richard (1993). ''Hunting the Devil: The Pursuit, Capture and Confession of the Most Savage Serial Killer in History''. Grafton. {{ISBN|0-06-017717-9}} * Wallace, Bill (2013). ''Mass Killers: Compelled to Destroy''. Canary Press. {{ISBN|978-1-907-79590-9}} ==External links== * ''Born to Kill in the USSR'' [http://borntokillintheussr.com/html/slivko.html image gallery] relating to Anatoly Slivko *[http://murderpedia.org/male.S/s/slivko-anatoly.htm Entry at murderpedia.org] {{DEFAULTSORT:Slivko, Anatoly}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:1989 deaths]] [[Category:Executed people from Dagestan]] [[Category:Executed Soviet people from Russia]] [[Category:Executed Soviet serial killers]] [[Category:LGBT people from Russia]] [[Category:Male serial killers]] [[Category:Necrophiles]] [[Category:People convicted of murder by the Soviet Union]] [[Category:People executed by the Soviet Union by firing squad]] [[Category:Russian murderers of children]] [[Category:Child sexual abuse in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Russian people convicted of murder]] [[Category:Russian people executed by the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Soviet serial killers]] [[Category:Violence against men in Europe]]

{{about||people named Stoneman|Stoneman (surname)|the [[Mega Man]] enemy|Robot Master|the Bollywood movie|The Stoneman Murders}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=May 2018}} {{one source|date=October 2018}} {{cleanup rewrite|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox murderer | name = Stoneman | image = | image_size = | caption = | alt = | birth_name = | alias = <!--Alternate names or titles given to or taken by the killer, such as "The Boston Strangler", "Jack the Rip", "Son of Sam", etc.--> | birth_date = <!-- {{birth date|YYYY|MM|DD}} if still living, use {{birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} death date is first, birth date is second --> | death_place = | cause = | conviction = | sentence = | victims = 13-26 | beginyear = 1985 | endyear = 1989 | country = [[India]] | states = | apprehended = Unapprehended | imprisoned = }}
The '''Stoneman''' is a name given by the popular English-language print media of [[Kolkata|Calcutta]], [[India]] to an unidentified [[serial killer]] who murdered at least 13 homeless people of that city during their sleep in 1989. The name is also given to the perpetrator of a similar series of murders in [[Mumbai|Bombay]] from 1985 to 1988. It has been speculated that these were the work of the same person, who could have been responsible for as many as 26 murders.
The Stoneman was blamed for thirteen murders over six months (the first in June 1989), but it was never established whether the crimes were committed by one person or a group of individuals. The [[Kolkata Police Force|Calcutta Police]] also failed to resolve whether any of the crimes were committed as a [[copycat crimes|copycat murder]]. To date, no one has been charged with any of the crimes; all thirteen cases remain unsolved.
==Bombay killings== The first hint of a [[serial-killer]] who was targeting homeless ragpickers and beggars in India came from [[Bombay]]. Starting in 1985, and lasting well over two years, a series of twelve murders were committed in the [[Sion, India|Sion]] and [[King's Circle]] locality of the city. The criminal or criminals' ''modus operandi'' was simple: first they would find an unsuspecting victim sleeping alone in a desolate area. The victim's head was crushed with a single stone weighing as much as 30 kg (~66 lbs). In most cases, the victims' identities could not be ascertained since they slept alone and did not have relatives or associates who could identify them. Compounded to this was the fact that the victims were people of very simple means and the individual crimes were not high-profile. It was after the sixth murder that the [[Bombay Police]] began to see a pattern in the crimes.
A stroke of luck seemed to come the police's way when a homeless waiter survived a brutal attack and managed to escape being bludgeoned to death. However, in the dimly lit area of Sion where he was sleeping, he had not been able to get a good look at his assailant, and what seemed like a big break came to naught.
Shortly afterwards, in 1987, a [[ragpicker]] was hacked to death in the adjoining suburb of [[Matunga]]. Even though the police and the media were quick to label this the handiwork of the same person, no evidence to link this crime with the others was ever found.
As mysteriously as the killings had started, by the middle of 1988, they stopped. To this date the case is unsolved.
==Summer of 1989 in Calcutta== Whether or not the Bombay killings were linked to the Calcutta "Stoneman" killings has never been confirmed. However, the uncanny similarity in the instrument, choice of victims, execution, and the time of the attacks suggests the assailant(s) was familiar with the Bombay episodes, if not the same killer himself.
The first victim in Calcutta died from injuries to the head in June 1989. Twelve more would die in the next six months as panic gripped the city. All of the murdered were homeless pavement-dwellers who slept alone in dimly lit areas of the city. Most of the murders took place in central Calcutta, adjoining the [[Howrah Bridge]].<ref name="ghoshhtimes">{{cite web |last1=Ghosh |first1=Ritujay |title=The elusive stoneman of Kolkata |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/india/the-elusive-stoneman-of-kolkata/story-BQBcCHfk87WvoLp2LSCKRN.html |website=HinduSan Stimes.com |publisher=Ritujay Ghosh |accessdate=11 October 2018}}</ref>
Because the murderer killed victims by dropping a heavy stone or concrete slab, the police assumed that the assailant was probably a tall, well-built male. However, in the complete absence of any eyewitnesses or survivors, no clear-cut leads were available.
Massive deployments of police in various parts of the city at night were resorted to, and numerous arrests were made. After a spell of arrests in which a handful of "suspicious persons" were rounded up for questioning, the killings stopped. However, since there was no incriminating evidence, all those summarily arrested had to be released. To date, the crimes remain unsolved.
==Stoneman in Guwahati== Similar incidents were reported in [[Guwahati]] city of [[Assam]] state during February 2009.
==Film adaptations based upon the events== Producer [[Bobby Bedi]] produced a film titled ''[[The Stoneman Murders]]'' based on these incidents. The film released on 13 February 2009, starring [[Kay Kay Menon]] and [[Arbaaz Khan]], and written and directed by [[Manish Gupta (director)|Manish Gupta]]. Gupta said that his story for the movie is 40% fact and 60% fiction. The movie depicts the killings to be a part of a religious ritual being conducted by a policeman, with the actual perpetrator left open to interpretation at the end.
In 2011, a Bengali film named ''[[Baishe Srabon]]'' released which was directed by Srijit Mukherjee. The plot of the movie revolved around the same mysterious serial killings in Kolkata, which took place during the period of 1989. In the movie, the assassin is shown to brutally murder and the victims mostly belonged to the ignoble and the plebeian league of the society; either prostitutes, anti-socials or street dwellers. However, the climax of the movie saw the serial killer shooting himself after confessing all his crudities, which, in fact, is a clear deviation from the actual incident.
